Subject: SUTDReviews --- Sharing reviews on SUTD Mods
Body:
Hey SUTDFam!!

 

Having trouble deciding what mods to take?  Want to find out more from those who have taken it before?

 

Fret not! A few SUTD seniors came together to create SUTDreviews <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsutdreviews.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf87193deeb3441d742f008d95585ab72%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637634854955512018%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Q7DNYDp2LVZqKqB4l1kpp1vEjvEodR3pbnQQgrL%2Bh64%3D&reserved=0> ! It's a website specially for SUTDents to share honest reviews on modules they have taken so that you can make better informed decisions on what modules to take.

 

Here is the beta version of the webpage, do show some support by leaving reviews for mods you have taken and giving us feedback for how it can be improved via the feedback form!

https://www.sutdreviews.com/ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutdreviews.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf87193deeb3441d742f008d95585ab72%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637634854955512018%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=HkJKn%2FqS1TLNTS7HoaJw8bGaDrm5g1z%2FFDPi1Usjt%2Bs%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutdreviews.com%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf87193deeb3441d742f008d95585ab72%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637634854955522015%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9nqhV686GCnqFFRjYvJd2bRG8xyg34GmGtDh5wA3u2I%3D&reserved=0> 

 

Happy mod planning!! 

 

 

Claudia Koh

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Froot.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cf87193deeb3441d742f008d95585ab72%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637634854955522015%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NjvthMUeDIDe9DmdatsI13flmKwMzxu7xmp%2F1NhXsu0%3D&reserved=0>

 Request for Interview for Pedagogical Project 
 

Hi there!

 

We would like to interview you as part of the project “Longitudinal Studies of Cohort-based Active and Design Learning in a Collaborative Classroom Environment". Your name has been randomly chosen (together with some of your peers) to be interviewed. We would like to find out more about your learning experiences in Modelling Space and Systems in the last term.

 

This interview will partly consist of filling in an online form, as well as a Microsoft Teams (or Zoom) interview online. Both parts will be anonymized.

 

You will be given $10 as reimbursement for this interview.

 

Please let both of us know if you would be willing to participate in this interview.

 

Regards,

Keegan and Da Yang

Subject: Change of Name for the ISTD Degree Programme
Body:
Students,

 

SUTD will be changing the name of its degree programme from the Bachelor of Engineering (Information Systems Technology and Design) to Bachelor of Engineering (Computer Science and Design). This name change will take effect from the graduating class of 2021 and will also affect the Minor programme. 

 

The decision to change the programme name to “Computer Science and Design (CSD)” aims to accurately reflect the interdisciplinary nature of the computing-intensive coupled with design curriculum that students have undergone in the ISTD pillar. Multiple discussions with various stakeholders such as alumni, current students, faculty and industry also highlighted strong reasons in support of this change.

 

In a survey of 177 participants from the stakeholder groups, 83% of them were in favour of renaming it “Computer Science and Design (CSD)”.

The curriculum of the CSD degree programme will remain essentially unchanged and is still accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Board (EAB). 

ISTD will continue to retain its pillar name at the Pillar level as it extensively covers general topics related to information systems and computer science.

 

Thank you for your attention.

 

Your sincerely,

Tony

=============================================================

Tony Q.S. Quek, Ph.D., Fellow of IEEE

Cheng Tsang Man Chair Professor and Full Professor

Head of Information Systems Technology and Design (ISTD) Pillar

Director, Future Communications R&D Programme

Deputy Director, SUTD-ZJU IDEA

Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)

 

Address: 8 Somapah Road, Singapore 487372

Email: tonyquek@sutd.edu.sg <mailtonyquek@sutd.edu.sg> 

Office: +65 6499-4573

Website: http://people.sutd.edu.sg/~tonyquek <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ffaculty.sutd.edu.sg%2F~tonyquek&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C80356b00a07e48ac2b9808d9536063c6%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637632495955674345%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gjhqQnBtLsAT4Trc%2Ffqr5SOWnKa5ScpPR1nfLmtA8N0%3D&reserved=0>

Hi Sumbul,

 

Thank you for the update.

 

Firstly, regarding copyright page – yes, the authors should maintain the copyright of their stories. Regarding the wording of the same on the page, among others points, we are not too sure about it. I am attaching a version here where we have done some amendments to the copyright page and the preface but would request you to please get it vet from someone in your team who is qualified to verify the language for the copyright page. 

 

Secondly, I am attaching two documents, one for the cover page and one for the section divider page (pagination page for the stories) for you to adapt. Am attaching them in both word and in pdf for you to be able to visualize how it will look. For the Section Divider, I would recommend to keep the visual elements as well.

 

Thirdly, regarding your other requests/doubts, I have created a doc which am attaching here as a reference guide for team.

 

I hope the details will be clear and if not, please do let me know!

 

Thanks,

Parul

  88 Call for Stories 

 

Hi Parul, Sheena

 

Great speaking to you. I have attached a Word file of the Ebook. 

 

Here's my understanding of the decisions & requests for samples, which would help us in quickly implementing the changes: 

*	All changes in Preface & front matter: I have attached the word file with the preface and front matter. Please feel free to make requisite edits.  
*	Please use a high-res Dsg logo: Please help us with a high-res Dsg logo 
*	I had recommended a Cover Page/ an Illustration for the  E-book. Can it still be explored? Please help us with a Word editable version of the Cover page. 
*	Subheads within stories should be sentence-cased. Please help us with a sample. 
*	All titles should be initial caps. Please help us with a sample. 
*	Images within the same story, if possible, should ideally be of the same dimensions, especially if they’re placed side by side; images should also align with column widths as much as possible. We can try to adjust the images a bit, but can't promise, as the original images might have underlying issues. We will crop/ adjust wherever possible. Please help us with the new images that you mentioned. 
*	Remove all image credits (should be quite self-explanatory that the images originated from the respective sources/authors); You can either change “Figure” to “Image” if they are “Images” and  drawings or illustrations be “Figure”. However, you can also remove all the “Figure 1”, “Figure 2” etc at the start of each caption as it’s obvious the captions are for the accompanying photos. OK, please help us with the sentence you want for image credits. 
*	Having pull-out quotes is good – suggest to have them in all stories to break the monotony (especially so for those stories without any photos). We agreed that we will keep current pagination & layout (pull out quotes in all stories will lead to spill over). 
*	A lot of the photos appear at the end of each story which isn’t ideal. Would it be possible to better feature them earlier on in the story, e.g. when it’s first mentioned, so readers can reference to them and it makes for a more engaging story, instead of just text. We will try to accommodate as much as possible. 
*	Also, we would like to propose a joint ownership i.e. both SUTD and Dsg for the E-book as per https://www.artsresourcehub.gov.sg/legal-support/intellectual-property-copyright#:~:text=In%20joint%20copyright%20ownership%2C%20each,creation%20of%20this%20joint%20work <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.artsresourcehub.gov.sg%2Flegal-support%2Fintellectual-property-copyright%23%3A~%3Atext%3DIn%2520joint%2520copyright%2520ownership%252C%2520each%2Ccreation%2520of%2520this%2520joint%2520work&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C19c1107836f14ea2cdc208d952706da6%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637631465898902569%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=O64TIj4cTfLkeSczoEf8mX02FNb95SU7n4hOmzNaP94%3D&reserved=0> . Please help us with the sentence you'd like us to insert in the copyright page. 
	
	
*	We will go with the map that we currently have as it is based on DSg template. 
*	QR codes have been used as 'fillers' in white space, we will create links wherever possible. 
*	We will update TOC for greater readability. 
*	
	
	

1.	Best
2.	Sumbul

Hi Sumbul,

 

We have gone through the PDF and collated our comments. Most of them have been added within the doc itself but sharing some over-arching points here as well. Also, will SUTD be proof-reading the stories once the contributors confirm and give their consent as well. We too of course will be doing with the same.

 

Here are some pointers:

*	All copy should be British spelling; spell out one to nine
*	Subheads within stories should be sentence-cased
*	All titles should be initial caps
*	Images within the same story, if possible, should ideally be of the same dimensions, especially if they’re placed side by side; images should also align with column widths as much as possible
*	Remove all image credits (should be quite self-explanatory that the images originated from the respective sources/authors); You can either change “Figure” to “Image” if they are “Images” and  drawings or illustrations be “Figure”. However, you can also remove all the “Figure 1”, “Figure 2” etc at the start of each caption as it’s obvious the captions are for the accompanying photos
*	Having pull-out quotes is good – suggest to have them in all stories to break the monotony (especially so for those stories without any photos)
*	A lot of the photos appear at the end of each story which isn’t ideal. Would it be possible to better feature them earlier on in the story, e.g. when it’s first mentioned, so readers can reference to them and it makes for a more engaging story, instead of just text.

For acknowledgements Page, here are the proposed names:

o   Emily Ong 

o   Ernest Paul

o   Eugene Chin 

o   Joanne Teh 

o   Sheena Lai 

o   Michelle Tan

o   Parul Kapur

o   Sandra Mae Manese

Also, we would like to propose a joint ownership i.e. both SUTD and Dsg for the E-book as per https://www.artsresourcehub.gov.sg/legal-support/intellectual-property-copyright#:~:text=In%20joint%20copyright%20ownership%2C%20each,creation%20of%20this%20joint%20work <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.artsresourcehub.gov.sg%2Flegal-support%2Fintellectual-property-copyright%23%3A~%3Atext%3DIn%2520joint%2520copyright%2520ownership%252C%2520each%2Ccreation%2520of%2520this%2520joint%2520work&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C19c1107836f14ea2cdc208d952706da6%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637631465898912564%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=H%2BytH46%2BAXx21uUifEJGGmvL%2Bt4KTMwWbfvW9c5XIlk%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Please share your feedback or concern if any regarding the same.

 

Thank you so much!

Regards,

Parul

Subject: Revised  Student Exco and Cohort Advisor  programmes
Body:
Student Reps,

 

Thank you for your commitment and contributions serving as Student Exco members over the past Term 1 and 2. We hope you have an enjoyable and  enriching experience in taking up the student leadership position in SUTD . 

 

With the adoption of the new academic calendar in which Freshmore Term 1 and Term 3 are overlapped in the Fall Term, and the regrouping of the Freshmore Term 3 students into new different cohorts according to your choice of the elective subjects under the new Freshmore curriculum, it is necessary to make certain revisions on the Student Exco Programme and Freshmore Cohort Advisor Programme accordingly to better adapt to these changes without compromising to your learning experience and growth during your Freshmore journey.

 

Revisions of Student Exco and Cohort Advisor programmes for Term 3 effective from Sept 2021:

 

1.       Cohort Advisor will serve only the first two terms, i.e. Term 1 and Term 2, not in Term 3.

 

2.       Student Exco of each cohort group will only be formed in Term 1 and Term 2, not in Term 3.

In Term 3, Office of Undergraduate Studies (UGS) will work with you to identify 2 to 3 student reps from each new cohort group, either by nomination or self-nomination, to manage the cohort classroom facilities and resources, such as the library books, AV system, stationery and etc, and UGS will take care of the Freshmore Term 3 students’ welfare in the areas of cohort classroom logistics matters.

 

3.	Keep the Best Class Spirit Award of $300 to be awarded after Term 2.

 

4.       Retain the cohort funding of $250 in Term 3. Funding utilization is subject to the UGS approval.

 

5.	Discontinue the Cleanest Cohort Classroom Award in Term 3.

 

6.	Discontinue the Cohort Classroom Design Competition.

 

 

Thanks.

Best regards

Lim Bee Foong

Manager, Office of Undergraduate Studies

Subject: Fwd: Housing offer for Term (Sep 2021 to Aug 2022) [Zhi Zhang Tee (1005136)]
Body:
________________________________

 SUTD Housing <ecchousing@sutd.edu.sg>
 Thursday, July 22, 2021 12:42:18 PM
 Student - Tee Zhi Zhang <zhizhang_tee@mymail.sutd.edu.sg>
 teezz24@hotmail.com <teezz24@hotmail.com>
 Housing offer for Term (Sep 2021 to Aug 2022) [Zhi Zhang Tee (1005136)] 
 

 Zhi Zhang Tee (1005136), 

 

Please read through this housing offer carefully as it contains important information that you need to take note of before accepting the offer.

 

We are pleased to offer you student housing as follows:

*	Check-in date*: 12 September 2021 (check-in timing to be advised)
*	Check-out date: 20 August 2022, 9.00am -11.00am
*	Offered accommodation: double room
*	Maximum occupancy: applicant only 

* If you are arriving from overseas, the check-in date is subject to COVID-19 terms stated in the FAQ, where applicable.  Check-in timing: as part of COVID-19 safe management measures, incoming residents may be allocated a specific timeslot for checking in.  You will be informed of your allocated check-in timeslot via email at a later date.

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

 

Attached with this email is a set of FAQs related to the acceptance of this housing offer. 

Please ensure you read through the attached FAQs carefully, especially if you:

 

a.    Are returning from overseas

 

b.    Have problems logging into the housing portal

 

c.    Wish to check in before 12 September 2021

 

d.    Wish to request for a change in room type

 

e.    Want to find out on how to choose your roommate (applicable only to students offered a double room)

 

During your stay in the hostel:

 

a.    You are expected to comply with any COVID-19 related instructions from the university (e.g. self-isolating within the hostel for a specific period of time, undergoing swabbing or other medical tests within the University or outside) as part of the University’s safe management measures should the need arise.

 

b.    You agree to undergo any COVID-19 related tests whenever specified by the University from time to time, with the understanding that the University will make every effort to minimize any expenses you need to incur. You agree that the university can terminate your housing agreement if you fail to comply with these agreements.

 

c.    This housing offer may be withdrawn if there are new developments imposed by the Singapore Government or decisions undertaken by the University that impact the hostel.  If this happens, the Office of Housing will try its best to provide as much advance notice as possible.  Please check your SUTD emails (if matriculated) or personal emails regularly.  Do also ensure that your Singapore mobile number (if any) is updated in MyPortal <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/>  in case we need to reach you urgently.

 

By accepting the housing offer, you are deemed to have acknowledged and agreed to the above.

 

Due to the dynamic COVID-19 global situation, the information above is subject to change.  

 

 


ACCEPTING THE HOUSING OFFER


 


1.    Acceptance period: Now to 29 July 2021 (2pm)

 

2.    How to accept: refer to the FAQ.

 

3.    Acceptance fee: SGD$200.  Once paid, this will be used to offset your housing fees.  If this is not paid by the end of the acceptance period, your housing offer will be withdrawn and your accommodation will be offered to the next person on the waitlist.  Your housing application will also be closed.

 

4.    If you are offered a double room: complete the lifestyle questionnaire as part of your acceptance process (you will see this step after you accept the housing offer online).  Your responses will help us in allocating your roommate, however please note that the roommate allocation is subject to constraints and will thus be at the sole and absolute discretion of the University. If you wish to specify a roommate, refer to the FAQ.

 

 

OTHER POINTS TO NOTE

 

1)    Please be aware of the total cost of your stay and any other important information before accepting the housing offer. The first bill is invoiced at the start of term.  Payment is due 7 days from the invoice date.  Late fees of $20 may be billed should payment be outstanding after each payment deadline. Please visit https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Campus-Life/Housing <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Campus-Life/Housing>  to find out more.  In addition, a list of housing-related fees and charges is attached (subject to change; the latest version can be found at https://tinyurl.com/officeofhousing <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fofficeofhousing&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C99c89df869d34e5dc3e708d94d0e068e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625545655269879%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=y4v0L9dWI9yr4FzcZPBo8zbaz60DXGTNEcibsvLsK%2B0%3D&reserved=0> ). 

 

2)    All fees paid are non-refundable.

 

3)    Your allocated room details will be made known during check-in.  We seek your understanding that specific room requests will not be considered.

 

4)    You are expected to familiarise yourself with the Student Housing Terms and Conditions. Please refer to the attachment (subject to change; the latest version will be found at https://tinyurl.com/officeofhousing <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fofficeofhousing&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C99c89df869d34e5dc3e708d94d0e068e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625545655269879%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=y4v0L9dWI9yr4FzcZPBo8zbaz60DXGTNEcibsvLsK%2B0%3D&reserved=0> , which requires login into your student account).  By accepting the housing offer, you are deemed to have agreed to adhere to the Housing Terms and Conditions and any other rules and regulations that may be imposed by the University from time to time.    

 

5)    The University reserves the right to withdraw this offer if you had breached the Student Housing Terms and Conditions or any other rules and regulations imposed by SUTD, or failed to pay your housing fees by the stipulated deadlines.

 

6)    Cancellation by resident:

 

a.    Before check-in: acceptance fee will be forfeited

 

b.    After check-in:

 

                                      i.        If intended check-out date is less than or equal to 14 calendar days after check-in date: liable for actual cost of stay till check-out and any applicable housing-related charges. In addition, the acceptance fee will be forfeited.

 

                                    ii.        If intended check-out date is more than 14 calendar days after check-in date: liable for a charge equivalent to housing fees corresponding to the full period of stay as stated in the Housing Offer and any applicable housing-related charges.

 

7)    Should there be a change in your graduation/conferment date or course end date during your period of stay, the housing offer check-out date may be revised accordingly.

 

All billing and future correspondence will be sent to your official SUTD student email account only (except for non-graduating exchange students who do not have an SUTD email address).  Please check your SUTD email account regularly to look out for emails on billing and payment as late charges may be imposed for missed payment deadlines.

 


ENQUIRIES


 

Please email us at ecchousing@sutd.edu.sg <mailecchousing@sutd.edu.sg> .

 

Regards,

 

Office of Housing

Subject: Closing the loop – Detailed notes for 3 July 2021 Conversations on Singapore Spirit are up!
Body:
External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

Greetings from the National Youth Council,

 



 

As promised, we are emailing you to let you know that the detailed notes are ready for viewing on Youthopia. 

 

Download detailed session notes on Youthopia

Head to Youthopia <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyouthopia.sg%2Fconverse%2Fsingaporespirit%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb947afcd1eef4e07886608d94d0e29e7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625545509493533%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=svSknXu7f9u5dRIug4hveHGdVUd%2Fn4CX2Q1uoS1KLdQ%3D&reserved=0> , a first-stop digital destination for youths by the National Youth Council to access detailed insights from the Conversation on Singapore Spirit on 3 July 2021 with your peers. You can also take a look at the summary of insights and detailed notes from the first three sessions that happened on 8th, 15th and 16th June 2021.  

 

Read more about the conversations via the articles below:

‘Madrasah students share what the Singapore Spirit means to them’ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyouthopia.sg%2Fread%2Fmadrasah-students-share-what-the-singapore-spirit-means-to-them%2F%3Futm_source%3Dfacebook%26utm_medium%3Dsocial-traffic%26utm_campaign%3DAO%2520-%2520OP%26utm_content%3Dmadrasah%2520students%2520singapore%2520spirit%26fbclid%3DIwAR3BPWErgo_4PxZqThSFvBRxaq3Pvu0WzL4PH7jqy1m3CS5tkxISq1JvB-Y&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb947afcd1eef4e07886608d94d0e29e7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625545509493533%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=s11BE0TNCEeWWe9qs7ztqSbRQfvF19JOT0cmyrd4jmE%3D&reserved=0> 

‘Polytechnic students: Multiculturalism is our defining Singaporean trait’ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fyouthopia.sg%2Fread%2Fpolytechnic-students-multiculturalism-is-our-defining-singaporean-trait%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb947afcd1eef4e07886608d94d0e29e7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625545509503528%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=5aPcdV4ueGjZdsEflDn5DBJvmxlIsaXnphT0%2FptPmq4%3D&reserved=0>

‘A caring S’pore will be ‘new glue’ that binds society: Edwin Tong’ <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.straitstimes.com%2Fsingapore%2Fcommunity%2Fa-caring-spore-will-be-new-glue-that-binds-society-edwin-tong&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb947afcd1eef4e07886608d94d0e29e7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625545509513523%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=tWt6P4Plz%2FLn9Z4NCGwilow4iv11CluP3F6JneaNjxQ%3D&reserved=0>

What’s next?

We were heartened by more than 3000 entries of avatars that visually represents our Singapore Spirit on our SG-Moji website. Continue to watch this space <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdstnct-dev.com%2Fsgmoji-final&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb947afcd1eef4e07886608d94d0e29e7%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637625545509533509%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Q9ati1rprzDFlmbVJwCaWiw%2F1HqIDs9TUm%2FDfbYuzIc%3D&reserved=0>  for a gallery celebrating our unique Singapore Spirit! 

 



 

In the meantime, stay safe and healthy 😊

 

Thank you.

Subject: Seeking for Volunteer Opportunities - BCS & SUTD
Body:
External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

Hi ,

Thank you for looking into this program! I've taken note of the tentative dates from 20-24 December 2021, we can finalise the date when more details are being firmed up.

The P3 & P4 class size is 21 pax & 13 pax respectively. On our end, we are alright for the on-site engagement to still carry on with this age group, though unvaccinated. 
Thank you for giving us the assurance that your team will be fully vaccinated by then!

Looking at the current cases & safe distancing measures, it is good to have an online schedule planned out like what your team initiated. 
In view of that, may I please suggest that your team propose a cut-off date for us to make a decision on whether we should proceed with an on-site or online program regardless of future changes in the safe distancing measures? This is to ensure that there is sufficient time for both parties adjust the program & getting the attendance of the children.

The general safe distancing measures that we have in our centre as of now a

- No more than 5 pax per group for activities/discussion, including students & volunteers
- Classes of different levels are not allowed to mingle 
- To try our best to maintain 1 metre distance between individuals & groups 

As the detailed safe distancing measures may change frequently, above are some basic general guidelines for us to follow. If there is anything else to add on along the way, I will keep you updated. Hope this clarifies!

Please feel free to contact me if more clarification is needed! Thank you.

Regards, 
Geraldine Woon 
Program Coordinator
Sunshine Club Student Care Centre
6645 0736/ 6645 0737


________________________________

 Student - Chua Yi Qi,  <_chua@mymail.sutd.edu.sg>
 Monday, 12 July 2021 2:41 PM
 Geraldine Woon <geraldinewoon@bethesdacare.sg>
 Chua Jun Ping <chuajunping@bethesdacare.sg>; Mandy Chua <mandy@bethesdacare.sg>; Student - Mohamad Arshad S/O Khaja Moinudeen <mohamad_arshad@mymail.sutd.edu.sg>; Student - Teo Jiawen <jiawen_teo@mymail.sutd.edu.sg>; Student - Lim Shu Hui Pamela <pamela_lim@mymail.sutd.edu.sg>
  Seeking for Volunteer Opportunities - BCS & SUTD 
 

Hi Geraldine,  

 

That’s some really great news! Looking forward to working with your team.  

 

After much discussion with my team, we are likely to organize the program on either of these dates, 20-24 December 2021, after our finals examination. In addition, we are looking into designing the program for P3 and/or P4 students. A query we have would be that is it possible to plan activities for this age group, as they cannot be vaccinated? If possible, may we know the cohort size for P3 and P4 respectively? If it’s not encouraged, would changing our target group to above 12 years old be more suitable? On our side, please rest assured that my team will be fully vaccinated by then.  

 

As much as we love to organize an on-site activity, we would plan an online schedule as well in case of any sudden wave of infection (touchwood!). Is it possible to share with us some safe management measures that you observe so that we can include similar measures in the proposal?  

 

Thank you so much and hope to hear from you soon!  

 

Have a great day!  

 


 Chua	  <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 	 
Director of Events	 
Events & Welfare Committee	 
9th Student Government, ROOT	 
Unwavering . Accountable . Collaborative	 






________________________________

 Geraldine Woon <geraldinewoon@bethesdacare.sg>
 06 July 2021 11:42
 Student - Chua Yi Qi,  <_chua@mymail.sutd.edu.sg>
 Chua Jun Ping <chuajunping@bethesdacare.sg>; Mandy Chua <mandy@bethesdacare.sg>
  Seeking for Volunteer Opportunities - BCS & SUTD 
 
External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

 ,

Thank you for expressing your interest in partnering Bethesda Care Services, Sunshine Club Student Care Centre! We are glad to hear from you on the potential volunteering opportunity, and we are definitely keen to partner with you be it on-site or online in accordance to the safe management measures.


The idea of blending Christmas with being environmentally friendly sounds great, with a mix of fun and interactive activities.


For a start, our centre consists of approximately 100 children, ranging from P1 to Sec 2, age 7 to 14 years old. We have 6 staff-in-charge for the respective classes. May I please ask if there is a specific age group you are looking at?


I understand that there are no fixed plans as of now as it is still quite some time away from Christmas. We can discuss along the way when more ideas are generated!

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you've further queries.


Regards,
Geraldine Woon 
Program Coordinator
Sunshine Club Student Care Centre

Subject: FW: 88 Call for Stories
Body:
Sumbul Khan <sumbul_khan@sutd.edu.sg> 
 Monday, 19 July 2021 3:39 pm
 Parul Kapur <Parul_Kapur@designsingapore.org>; Joanne Teh <joanne_teh@designsingapore.org>; Sheena LAI <sheena_lai@designsingapore.org>
 Student - Ong Lok Hen <lokhen_ong@mymail.sutd.edu.sg>
  88 Call for Stories 

 

Hi Parul, Sheena

 

Great speaking to you. I have attached a Word file of the Ebook. 

 

Here's my understanding of the decisions & requests for samples, which would help us in quickly implementing the changes: 

*	All changes in Preface & front matter: I have attached the word file with the preface and front matter. Please feel free to make requisite edits.  
*	Please use a high-res Dsg logo: Please help us with a high-res Dsg logo 
*	I had recommended a Cover Page/ an Illustration for the  E-book. Can it still be explored? Please help us with a Word editable version of the Cover page. 
*	Subheads within stories should be sentence-cased. Please help us with a sample. 
*	All titles should be initial caps. Please help us with a sample. 
*	Images within the same story, if possible, should ideally be of the same dimensions, especially if they’re placed side by side; images should also align with column widths as much as possible. We can try to adjust the images a bit, but can't promise, as the original images might have underlying issues. We will crop/ adjust wherever possible. Please help us with the new images that you mentioned. 
*	Remove all image credits (should be quite self-explanatory that the images originated from the respective sources/authors); You can either change “Figure” to “Image” if they are “Images” and  drawings or illustrations be “Figure”. However, you can also remove all the “Figure 1”, “Figure 2” etc at the start of each caption as it’s obvious the captions are for the accompanying photos. OK, please help us with the sentence you want for image credits. 
*	Having pull-out quotes is good – suggest to have them in all stories to break the monotony (especially so for those stories without any photos). We agreed that we will keep current pagination & layout (pull out quotes in all stories will lead to spill over). 
*	A lot of the photos appear at the end of each story which isn’t ideal. Would it be possible to better feature them earlier on in the story, e.g. when it’s first mentioned, so readers can reference to them and it makes for a more engaging story, instead of just text. We will try to accommodate as much as possible. 
*	Also, we would like to propose a joint ownership i.e. both SUTD and Dsg for the E-book as per https://www.artsresourcehub.gov.sg/legal-support/intellectual-property-copyright#:~:text=In%20joint%20copyright%20ownership%2C%20each,creation%20of%20this%20joint%20work <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.artsresourcehub.gov.sg%2Flegal-support%2Fintellectual-property-copyright%23%3A~%3Atext%3DIn%2520joint%2520copyright%2520ownership%252C%2520each%2Ccreation%2520of%2520this%2520joint%2520work&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C153f43f0145d4d7f7fcb08d94c57e5ab%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637624762985274120%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Bgcnhe3C7b8B%2BMaoD%2F4XBXkajGYNRJUBcpskRtMLSeQ%3D&reserved=0> . Please help us with the sentence you'd like us to insert in the copyright page. 
*	We will go with the map that we currently have as it is based on DSg template. 
*	QR codes have been used as 'fillers' in white space, we will create links wherever possible. 
*	We will update TOC for greater readability. 
*	 

1.	Best
2.	Sumbul

 Parul Kapur <Parul_Kapur@designsingapore.org <mailParul_Kapur@designsingapore.org> >
 Friday, 16 July 2021 3:54 PM
 Sumbul Khan <sumbul_khan@sutd.edu.sg <mailsumbul_khan@sutd.edu.sg> >; Joanne Teh <joanne_teh@designsingapore.org <mailjoanne_teh@designsingapore.org> >; Student - Ong Lok Hen <lokhen_ong@mymail.sutd.edu.sg <maillokhen_ong@mymail.sutd.edu.sg> >

  88 Call for Stories 

 

External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

Hi Sumbul,

 

We have gone through the PDF and collated our comments. Most of them have been added within the doc itself but sharing some over-arching points here as well. Also, will SUTD be proof-reading the stories once the contributors confirm and give their consent as well. We too of course will be doing with the same.

 

Here are some pointers:

*	All copy should be British spelling; spell out one to nine
*	Subheads within stories should be sentence-cased
*	All titles should be initial caps
*	Images within the same story, if possible, should ideally be of the same dimensions, especially if they’re placed side by side; images should also align with column widths as much as possible
*	Remove all image credits (should be quite self-explanatory that the images originated from the respective sources/authors); You can either change “Figure” to “Image” if they are “Images” and  drawings or illustrations be “Figure”. However, you can also remove all the “Figure 1”, “Figure 2” etc at the start of each caption as it’s obvious the captions are for the accompanying photos
*	Having pull-out quotes is good – suggest to have them in all stories to break the monotony (especially so for those stories without any photos)
*	A lot of the photos appear at the end of each story which isn’t ideal. Would it be possible to better feature them earlier on in the story, e.g. when it’s first mentioned, so readers can reference to them and it makes for a more engaging story, instead of just text.

For acknowledgements Page, here are the proposed names:

o   Emily Ong 

o   Ernest Paul

o   Eugene Chin 

o   Joanne Teh 

o   Sheena Lai 

o   Michelle Tan

o   Parul Kapur

o   Sandra Mae Manese

Also, we would like to propose a joint ownership i.e. both SUTD and Dsg for the E-book as per https://www.artsresourcehub.gov.sg/legal-support/intellectual-property-copyright#:~:text=In%20joint%20copyright%20ownership%2C%20each,creation%20of%20this%20joint%20work <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.artsresourcehub.gov.sg%2Flegal-support%2Fintellectual-property-copyright%23%3A~%3Atext%3DIn%2520joint%2520copyright%2520ownership%252C%2520each%2Ccreation%2520of%2520this%2520joint%2520work&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C153f43f0145d4d7f7fcb08d94c57e5ab%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637624762985284115%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=z6V6UonHeG1Li1UDWNE3Uro1NP8xXRldv9ScWVTiVIA%3D&reserved=0> .

 

Please share your feedback or concern if any regarding the same.

 

Thank you so much!

Regards,

Parul

 Request for Interview for Pedagogical Project 

 

Hi there!

 

We would like to interview you as part of the project “Longitudinal Studies of Cohort-based Active and Design Learning in a Collaborative Classroom Environment". Your name has been randomly chosen (together with some of your peers) to be interviewed. We would like to find out more about your learning experiences in Modelling Space and Systems in the last term.

 

This interview will partly consist of filling in an online form, as well as a Microsoft Teams (or Zoom) interview online. Both parts will be anonymized.

 

You will be given $10 as reimbursement for this interview.

 

Please let both of us know if you would be willing to participate in this interview.

 

Regards,

Keegan and Da Yang

,

Thanks and all the best!

 

Quin

  UROP application 

 

 ,

 

Thank you for taking the time to have a little chat with us today regarding your UROP application. As the UROP demands the ability of the student to read and distill key findings of journal articles (and possible book articles), we would like to have a quick understanding of your propensity to undertake the task. I’ve attached a brief article on entrepreneurial traits. Could you kindly read the article and submit to me an approximately 500-word summary of it by the end of Thursday 13 May? The summary should include an introduction, methods, results, discussion/conclusion, and your brief critical analysis of the article.

 

Please feel free to ask me any questions that you may have.  Look forward to receiving your summary soon!

 

Thanks!

 

Best regards,

Quin

Subject: SUTD New Password Policy
Body:
Students,

 

With the adoption of Enhanced Access and Secure Entry (EASE), changes will be made to the password requirements in our Computer Network and Internet Acceptable Use Policy.

 

The key revised highlights of this policy are as follow:

 

1.            User Account Password Length - Existing 8 characters to 12 characters

 

2.            Password Expiry - Expiry from 90 days to 365 days

 

3.            Account Lockout Threshold - Retries attempt from 3 to 5

 

You EASE account will have the changes implemented as follow: 



Note:     Phase One will run for 3 months to enable full cycle for all user’s password length to be 12 or more alphanumeric characters. 

               Your next password prompt for change will be 12 months later after the 3 months period or 1st Nov 2021.

 

If you have any questions or encounter difficulty, please contact IT Service Desk at 6499-4500 or email: help-it@sutd.edu.sg <mailhelp-it@sutd.edu.sg> 

 

Thank you for your support and attention.

 

Best Regards,

SUTD IT Service Desk

Office of Information Technology (OIT)

Subject: [EASE] VPN Old links removal
Body:
Students,

 

The Enhanced Access and Secure Entry (EASE) integration with our Pulse Secure VPN has been rollout for a while and we believed you must be familiar with the new login process with Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).

 

Do note that from 23rd August 2021, access via VPN will only be allowed using your EASE login from the “SUTD VPN Connection” profile or the VPN URL  https://sutdvpn.sutd.edu.sg/remote. 

 

You can refer to the attached “Guide to login to SUTD VPN v1.0.pdf”  for reference.

 

To quickly check that you have the correct profile, you can click on the triangle icon next to the VPN profile and verify that the URL is as shown below:

 



 

If you have any questions or encounter difficulty during the enrolment, please contact IT Service Desk at 6499-4500 or email: help-it@sutd.edu.sg <mailhelp-it@sutd.edu.sg> 

 

Thank you for your support and attention.

 

Best Regards,

SUTD IT Service Desk

Office of Information Technology (OIT)

Subject: Cohort Co-Advisor
Body:
all,

 

Hope you are enjoying your Summer Term. Time flies and you will be moving into Term 3 soon! 

 

As student leaders of the Freshmores, we are fully confident that the role you have played and the experience you have gained as Chairs and Deputy Chairs of the cohort excos are beneficial to you. We would like to invite you to join as cohort co-advisors and work together with the faculty / staff cohort advisors to provide mentorship, friendship and advice to the Freshmores of AY2021 to enhance the SUTD community spirit and foster SUTD values among the Freshmore students, helping them to develop themselves into technically grounded leaders and innovators.

 

If you are keen to participate, please write to us by 13 Aug 21 (Fri). The details of the cohort advisor program is attached herewith for your reference.

 

We look forward to your favorable reply.

 

Best regards

Bee Foong

On Mon, Jul 12, 2021, 01:35 Student - Chua Yi Qi,  <_chua@mymail.sutd.edu.sg <mail_chua@mymail.sutd.edu.sg> > wrote:


	Hello! 

	First of all, I would like to apologize sincerely for sending this application late as I was considering really thoroughly. After much thought, I decided that I would like to join this program and thus applying for it, which links me to the first question. Hope you would still give this application a read, thank you!

	1.Why do you want to join the program? (Max 100 words) 
	14 months ago, I was hesitating between SMU Business and SUTD. Though coming into SUTD is a great decision, there's still some regret in me for not studying business. As such, I'm intending to pursue a business-related Masters's instead. Filled with lots of great resources, like mentorship and the opportunity to work on case studies, this program is one step closer to my dream and fulfilling it earlier. So, why not? University to me is about self-exploration and preparing me for the real world ahead. I genuinely hope to be enrolled in this to enrich my learning journey in SUTD. 

	2.What career do you wish to pursue? (Max 100 words)
	
	To be very truthful, I don't have a specific answer as I'm not sure what lies ahead of me. However, the concept of Artificial Intelligence and Big Data attracts me and I'm intending to pursue a degree in DAI or ESD. Subsequently, I may find a career related to Business analytic, AI-related developer, or designer. Once, I read about specialists vs generalists. Greedy as I am, I wish for myself to be a 'T-shaped' person, one filled with the breadth of knowledge and depth of expertise. On top of learning new skills, I wish to be enrolled in this program.

	Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to read this and hope to hear from you soon 🙂
	
	
	Yours sincerely, 
	 Chua 
	Telegram handle: @_chua
	Instagram handle: @_fatqi

Subject: Update on Safety & Control Measures (23rd August 2021)
Body:
Student,

In accordance with the latest COVID-19 advisories from the various government agencies on 6th August 2021, Residents are advised to take note of the latest safety and control measures effective 19th August 2021 whilst residing in the hostel. 
(Highlighted in red)

1.           Daily Declarations - Residents are required to complete the following online declarations daily:

a)    Daily (Health) Declaration                   once daily

b)    Temperature Declaration                    No Longer Required

Log in to https://tts.sutd.edu.sg <https://tts.sutd.edu.sg/>  to submit your declarations.

2.         Feeling Unwell – Residents with high temperature (37.6 degrees Celsius or more) or who are ill should see a doctor immediately and inform the Resident Life Coordinators (RLCs) if they have been tested for COVID-19. RLCs may be contacted at 9720 9316 (Melissa) / 9230 3853 (Peggy) / 9296 2691 (Chalit)  
COVID-19 test results must also be reported immediately to the RLCs.

3.         Carry Your ID - Please always carry your Student ID and room card with you as hostel and campus security officers will be conducting identity checks.  Residents who do not produce these cards will not be allowed to enter the hostel and may be denied entry to other parts of campus.

4.         Entering Hostel - You may enter the hostel only via level 2.  All other hostel access points (including those at level 1) will be disabled until further notice.  Residents found entering the hostel through access points other than the designated level 2 entry points will be subject to disciplinary action.

5.         No Visitors – Visitors are not allowed within the hostel (‘visitors’ are defined as persons who do not live in the hostel and may include SUTD staff, students & alumni).

6.         Wear a Mask – Do wear a mask the moment you leave your room for any purpose. The mask may be temporarily removed only during strenuous exercises and during meals.

7.         Gathering in Rooms – Only 1 cross-room visitor (residents only) is allowed per hostel resident. Residents are still required to wear a mask & maintain at least a 1-metre safe distancing when having visitors.

8.         Group Gatherings – Any group gatherings must be kept to a maximum of 5 persons at any given time, unvaccinated people encouraged to stay in groups of up to 2. Residents should cap their gatherings to 2 per day, with effect Tuesday, 10th August 2021.

Safe distancing measures are to always be observed.

9.         Safe Distancing – Do not sit on the marked-out seats. Please adhere to capacity limits of the communal facilities and maintain at least a 1-metre distance from each other.

10.       Safe Entry – With effect from Wednesday, 12th May 2021, ONLY Trace Together App or Token may be used for entry into SUTD via Campus Centre Level 1, Lobby F Level 1 or SRC. Do check in at these locations.

Please remember to bring along your token or mobile with Safe Entry (SE) app whenever you leave your room. This is to aid contact tracing, when necessary, by the authorities.

11.       Check in – Please do a Safe Entry check in, every time you return to campus

12.       TraceTogether – Remember to bring along your TraceTogether token or mobile with TraceTogether app whenever you leave your hostel room.

13.       Health Risk Warning or Alert – Students who have been put under the Ministry of Health's (MOH's) Health Risk Warning (HRW) will be placed on Leave of Absence (LOA), and will only be allowed to return to campus after their exit Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) swab test result is negative.

Students who have been put under Health Risk Alert (HRA) will be able to return to campus but should limit their social interactions as an added precaution, monitor their health and see a doctor promptly if they feel unwell.

14.       Sporting Facilities – SUTD indoor sporting facilities will reopen from 10th August 2021. Only users in compliance with the Vaccination-differentiated SMMs (VDS) will be allowed entry.

Let us play our part to keep our friends, loved ones and ourselves safe during this trying period. 

Best Regards,
Office of Housing

Block 59, #01-91
Changi South Avenue 1, Singapore 485999  

Website: www.sutd.edu.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C6032653df7b44075018008d965fa9950%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637652949251248877%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YZqBZJ%2FXxAekoP3cXCuHNIfGRrfxZOkIKMBkwLlS%2F8g%3D&reserved=0>   

Tel: 6434 8225

(Operating hours: Mondays – Thursdays, 8.30 am to 6 pm, and Fridays, 8.30 am to 5.30 pm. Closed on weekends and public holidays)

Subject: eDimension and Blue Integration with EASE
Body:
Students,

 

We are continuously improving the security of our Learning Systems to provide you with a safer cyber environment. We are pleased to announce that eDimension and Blue will be integrated with SUTD’s Enhanced Access and Secure Entry (EASE).

 

With this integration, Multifactor Authentication (MFA) will be used when accessing eDimension and Blue (Course Evaluation). 

 

From 30 Aug 2021 9:00 am, you will be prompted for your EASE MFA in addition to your EASE ID and password when accessing eDimension and Blue. 

 

Please refer to the attached guides for your reference.

 

If you encounter any issue when accessing eDimension and Blue, please email to us at edi_admin@sutd.edu.sg <mailedi_admin@sutd.edu.sg> .

 

Regards,

eDimension Admin

Body:
External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

Hi, .

Thank you for choosing Gift Market! :)

Below is the quote for your kind reference:

Product Name: Vinyl Sticker (Kiss-Cut)
Printing: Customised
Logo Size (if required): 16x9cm
Colors Available In Stock: -
Unit Price: $3.74/pc (inc GST)
Quantity: 320 pcs per design (Total: 2 designs)
Lead-Time Required: 5-6 Working Days
https://www.giftmarket.com.sg/item/2207/vinyl-sticker-kiss-cut/?q=16&opt_type=ips&opt_id=20206&a0=2053&a1=2023&a2=2026

Price is inclusive GST and 1 free delivery trip to your address. Production will begin upon artwork approval and quotation endorsement.

If you wish to proceed, do send me the high resolution version of your logo/design so that I can draft a digital layout for your approval :) (Preferably in ai/eps/pdf format)

On a side note, do also let me know your preferred colour for the item chosen as some of the items comes with different color options.

If you do have any questions or if there is anything i can help do feel free to let me know :)

Look forward to hearing from you!

Best Regards,

Dian (Customer Happiness Officer) | www.giftmarket.com.sg | Direct: +65 3129 4161 | 9 Kaki Bukit Road 2 #04-25 Gordon Warehouse Building Singapore 41784

Hi , 

 

No worries, I will provide a rough quote based on specs given.

 

Customize Stickers 

Printing: Full colour printing 

Qty: 640 (320 each for one design, two designs in total)

Price: S$ 1.50/pc before GST 7%

 

1.	How much would delivery cost?

Delivery cost will be S$ 30 before GST 7% to 1 Singapore location.

Yes, address under my signature.

We accept Cash, Cheque and Bank Transfer.

Subject: Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter
Body:
,

 

How are you and so happy to hear from you! 

 

I would be delighted for you to share your experience as a Freshmore student, can be anything really. Highlighted events, what you enjoy most in the first two terms (subject wise, the curriculum, SMT subject, schooling in the pandemic period etc, just some suggestion) and of course you can dedicate your words to F05 as well. 

 

Choose any style or format you want to present, the choice is yours :) The word limit is just an indication of how much we can fit into one page and send me the original photos, as many that you think can fit into one page including caption. We will revise your article on our side after your submission for your review as well. 

 

Feel free to email me if you have any further questions :)

 

Thank you once again and look forward to receive your article.

 

Best Regards,

Eng Ying 

 

 Student - Chua Yi Qi,  
 Tuesday, 24 August 2021 3:19 PM
 Bong Eng Ying <engying_bong@sutd.edu.sg>
 Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter

 

Hi Eng Ying! 

 

Joseph shared with me regarding the SMT Newsletter, and I would love to be part of it! As the class will be split based on electives in Term 3, I was thinking of an article dedicating to F05 before we proceed to our new classes. However, I’m not sure if this topic would be possible. I could write about my Freshmore experience in general if you would prefer that as well. 

 

In addition, I saw the previous newsletter and noticed that some articles wrote from the 3rd POV while some used the Q&A method. Which kind of style should I be using? Apart from the 300 word limit, are there other restrictions like number of images and number of points I should be mentioning?

 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

 Chua

Subject: [Application Open] PSEA Withdrawal, September 2021 Term
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 Students

 

We would like to inform you that application to withdraw funds from your PSEA (Post-Secondary Education Account) for September 2021 Term is now open.

 

You may withdraw funds from your PSEA for the following:

*	Tuition fees
*	Compulsory miscellaneous fees
*	Hostel fees (*only applicable for first 2 academic terms in Freshmore year) 

 

If you wish to do so, please submit your application by the stipulated deadline. Students who had already applied for the Standing Order need not re-apply.

 

Payment for

Details of Scheme

Deadline for Application

How to apply

• Compulsory miscellaneous fees

PSEA

Subject: SHG Term Appointment (from Sep 2021)
Body:
,

 

We are pleased to have you continue as a HG from Sep 2021. Please find attached your Appointment Letter and Annex 1. Do read both documents carefully.

 

Dr. Serena Lim (Head, Office of Student Life) is bcc’d here in lieu of your Appointment Letter being computer generated without her signature.

 

Kindly reply to indicate your acceptance of the appointment offer and to confirm that you will be assuming HG duties from 12 September 2021. Pls also ensure that both your Appointment Letter and Annex 1 (e-signed on every page) are attached in your email reply, for Housing’s reference when I forward it to them later.  

 

Thank you.

 

Regards,

Peggy

Office of Student Life

Subject: Notice for Students (26 August 2021)
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 

 Students,

 

In line with the national stance of transiting to the endemic state and the Ministry of Education (MOE)’s latest Safe Management Measures (SMMs), our university will adopt the safe management measures to keep faculty, students and staff safe.

 

(A) Teaching Plan: 13 Sep to 22 Oct (Week 1 to 6) and 1 Nov to 17 Dec 2021 (Week 8 to 14 )

 

1.           Term 1 and Term 3 subjects will have on-campus lessons in the respective designated cohort classroom except:

*         A few classes may have specific requirements for online learning mode. The respective faculty/office will inform you for these classes.

 

2.           Term 6 Pillar subjects will have online classes from Week 1 to Week 6. Hybrid mode may resume progressively, subject to the latest advisory from the related government agencies.

 

3.           Term 10 subject(s) will have on-campus lesson. Thesis students will arrange appointment with their mentors to update progress, when necessary.

 

4.           PG subjects will have online classes during office hours and can be physical after 6pm from Week 1 to Week 6. Hybrid mode may resume progressively, subject to the latest advisory from the related government agencies.

 

5.           Mid-term and final examinations will be conducted on campus.

 

6.           Class size of all physical lessons is capped at 50 pax (including instructors).  Any classes with more than 50 pax (including instructors) will go online. The respective subject lead and pillar/cluster will inform the students for these classes of the arrangements, if any.

 

7.           Group discussion/activity is capped at 5 pax per group, (regardless of the individuals’ vaccination status), and with SMMs in place.

*         Faculty/Students should have their mask on at all times, and maintain a safe distancing of at least 1 metre between persons (or between groups of not more than 5 persons for group activities/team-based labs/projects/ASD studios). No intermingling between groups.

 

8.         Graduate students performing research who need to return to research-lab/facility, please continue to seek clearance via your advisors/project-PIs/lab-managers.  For those who need to access Graduate Student Clusters (GSC), follow up instructions from the Office of Graduate Studies on the SMMs will be provided in regards to its reopening.

 

Notes for Section A 

 

*         As the situation is fluid and teaching plan can change in a short span of time, please refer to the instruction from the faculty, pillars, clusters, departments or offices for the latest and specific arrangement. 

*         If you have an online lesson in-between two on-campus in-person lessons, or back-to-back between an online lesson & on-campus in-person lesson on the same day, 

a)            you shall go to interim study room/library/open spaces/ASD respective studios and designated rooms for online lessons/self-study, subject to availability and safe distancing measures

b)            return to hostel room, if you are a hostel resident.

*         Please refer to the attached PDF for the operating hours at the respective academic spaces and facilities. The operating hours is subject to changes in response to the evolving situation. Students shall refer to the latest notice from the respective departments or offices (e.g. Library/Fab lab)

 

(B) Safe management measures

 

The university will continue to adhere to safe management measures to keep our SUTD community safe.  As the situation continues to evolve, we will provide updates in response to new advisory from the related government agencies. Please continue to observe the measures on the days when you are on campus.

 

(I) COVID-19 vaccination

 

While COVID-19 vaccination is not mandatory, we encourage students who have not been vaccinated and are medically eligible for vaccination to sign up for it at www.vaccine.gov.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.vaccine.gov.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cbc5345d5a6b041ecd89408d968281a68%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637655344342375866%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YPCjz2%2BNfGC2mUdbHrzvk3Um0R%2FyMp3vuc4J3aJLFOU%3D&reserved=0>  as early as possible.

 

(II) Before you come to campus

 

Please check in using the TraceTogether token or app before you are allowed entry onto campus. You should have your TraceTogether token or app with you throughout.

 

Please do not come onto campus if you or

*         your household members are unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice

*         your roommate is unwell, with flu-like/respiratory symptoms or on Home Quarantine Order/Stay Home Notice (applicable to students staying in hostel’s twin-sharing room)

 

Please refer to the attached list of scenarios where Leave of Absence will be issued or students will have to apply for Leave of Absence via MyPortal.

 

When you are not able to attend classes due to reasons such as the above scenarios or medical reasons, please do:

*         inform your faculty of your absence

*         submit your leave of absence via MyPorta <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/psp/EPPRD/?cmd=login&languageCd=ENG> l> NavBar> Navigator> Self Service> Leave/Withdrawal Request> Leave of Absence Application.

 

(III) When you are on campus

 

1)    Masks must be worn at all times except when you are eating or drinking.

2)    Please check-in at Campus Centre or Lobby F for completion of TraceTogether-only SafeEntry at least 20 minutes before the scheduled class time. For those who are driving or riding in, you will check-in at Entrance C (2nd vehicular entrance along Changi South Ave 1).



 

3)    The start and end time of each class must be strictly adhered to.  If you are unwell with dry cough, fever and tiredness, do not come to class but visit the Public Health Preparedness Clinic (PHPC).

4)    You are required to do your daily health and contact declaration via the Daily and Travel Declaration System at https://tts.sutd.edu.sg <https://tts.sutd.edu.sg> .

5)    You will only be allowed on campus on the days when you are scheduled for classes and/or related academic activities.  The security will have the class list for verification.

 

(IV) Teaching venues

 

1)    You can only be on campus for the duration of the class instructions and related academic activities. 

2)    Venues designated for teaching will have the requisite social distancing measures in place.

3)    Freshmore students (Term 1 & Term 3) will be assigned in groups of not more than 5 students per group. Hence, Freshmore students will be assigned a group and a seat number in your respective Cohort Classroom. Please minimise your interactions by working within a fixed group of no more than 5 persons and occupying the assigned seat for lessons. More information on the assigned seating arrangement will be conveyed to freshmore students between 8 and 10 September 2021.

4)    The university would need to keep records of students’ seating arrangements (e.g. Faculty taking photos at the start/end of sessions) to allow affected students to be identified quickly in the event of a confirmed case and for subsequent contact tracing.

5)    Once the class instructions and related academic activities are over for the day, please do not loiter around the classroom. For those who are hostel residents, please return to the hostel; for the rest, please leave campus as soon as possible.

6)    Please observe personal and environmental hygiene with regular hand washing.

 

(V) Consumption of food

 

1)    Meals can only be consumed at the designated refreshment areas only (Canteen, F&B outlets etc) and should not be at student spaces and common areas. Individuals are to mask up immediately after eating, and leave the designated refreshment areas after finishing your meals.

2)    Please clear your table after the meal.

 

As these measures are to ensure the safety and wellbeing of everyone, compliance is mandatory.  Disciplinary actions will be taken against the student(s) for any violation.

 

 

Best regards,

Office of Student Administration

Subject: IDEATE Certificate and Wrap Up
Body:
External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 


 Ideator, 

We have officially ended all things related to IDEATE 2021 (if you are a prize winner, fret not we will send more details on the prizes shortly after this). Congratulations on completing the 2.5 days of hard work with us and thank you for making IDEATE 2021 the success it was. We appreciate each and every one of you for attending and doing your best during the Ideathon, we could not have asked for a better audience. We were truly amazed and intrigued by all the solutions you managed to come up with in such a short time frame. We hope you had a great time brainstorming and had a meaningful experience throughout the event. We would also like to thank you for all the feedback you gave us, we have looked through it and we cannot wait to implement the changes in IDEATE 2022 to make it an even better experience for our future attendees.

Lastly, the thing you have been waiting for: your certificates. It has been attached to this email, do have a look through it and if there are any errors in your name or changes you need made contact me on Telegram @iamanuuuuu. All requests for changes or errors must be made before 5 September 2021, we will not be handling anymore requests after that.


Best Regards,
Anurag Mahlawat
National University of Singapore

Head of Outreach Department
iDP Students Club

Body:
External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

 

HI , 


for your reference:

please inform the width x length or diameter.

total pcs each design

cutting line -  cutting square, rectangle, circle, cut to shape (add stroke)

 

material:
vinyl white base color

vinyl transparent (can't print white ink)

  

Finishing

die cut - cutting by 1 each design  cut individually 
kisscut - cutting by 1 each design (which you can peel easily)  but still in a big roll

sheet sticker- variation design in 1 sheet cutting by 1 each design (which you can peel easily)  but still in a sheet a4, a5, a6 


Laminate

Glossy Lamination: shiny effect on the surface, the colors look brighter.

Frosted Matte/Doff Lamination: non shiny surface, the colors look softer

 

please send to me for design:

- Exact size and shape

- Resolution min 300DPI or more

- File in png/jpg

- Make sure you double check if you zoom in to 100% all elements are sharp.

-maks 3 MB

 

Update me your :

Recipient name:
Phone

Delivery address:(if office address pls provide opening hour)

postal code:

Subject: [Virtual FACT 2021 - DTIxSZTU] Reading Materials on China
Body:
Students,

 

As we approach our virtual FACT programme for ‘Design Thinking & Innovation @ Shenzhen Technology University (DTIxSZTU)’ from 01 – 04 Sep 2021, the Office of International Relations has compiled a series of resource materials for your perusal.

 

We hope these reading materials will provide you with some background knowledge and overview on China, which will be helpful in gaining insight and awareness of the region prior to our virtual FACT programme.

 

Spotlight on China



Did you know China is a multi-nation with 56 ethnic groups? Find out more he Country Profile <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eyeonasia.gov.sg%2Fchina%2Fknow%2Foverview-of-china%2Fchina-a-country-profile%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2dcf5155fd434288c4bb08d96b985adb%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659124381678632%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=LmobeN9QfdcwBV%2Fjoovvk4k248E6krwhg92dU7ABXic%3D&reserved=0> 

*         Living in China (Recommended readings from NLB)

o   China’s rising cashless society <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eyeonasia.gov.sg%2Fchina%2Fknow%2Fliving-in-china%2Frising-cashless-society%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2dcf5155fd434288c4bb08d96b985adb%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659124381688628%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=n3wrVUyshDjEuA5rmEqusOjGHjO7I1pdlIaHHgaHhaw%3D&reserved=0> 

o   Chinese food culture <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eyeonasia.gov.sg%2Fchina%2Fknow%2Fliving-in-china%2Ffood-culture%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2dcf5155fd434288c4bb08d96b985adb%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659124381698625%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cdynQ7Ueo4CSuyzWGGwPkNzzye0rGuvDxKjqXm%2FCv%2Fk%3D&reserved=0> 

o   Looking at China’s financial and banking sector <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eyeonasia.gov.sg%2Fchina%2Fknow%2Fliving-in-china%2Ffinancial-and-banking-sector%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C2dcf5155fd434288c4bb08d96b985adb%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637659124381698625%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=0NzJruxoSqFxA5vzwBP49xKbYdvCuTK%2BLJZbPpwzDg4%3D&reserved=0>

  Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter 

 

 ,

 

Hooray! You guys are the best class and congratulations on winning the best class spirit award and thank you on behalf of the class for writing up the submission :) And I think your article came at the perfect timing to commemorate F05. The video is so cute, love seeing everyone faces there. 

 

I sincerely appreciate your time in writing up the article. For you information, SMT is a cluster consist most of the Freshmore subjects as well as few minor program in the upper year too. Unfortunately for the first 2 term, 3.007 course is not part of SMT. I include the link here for your reference: https://smt.sutd.edu.sg/education/undergraduate/courses/. Since your article will be published in SMT newsletter, I thought it will be nice (if any) to showcase any SMT relevant subjects or faculty too? This is just my opinion so that your experience is share at the right platform. I will help you check if your message to 3.007 course and faculty could be publish in another newsletter. I am sure they will be more than happy to have your experience share there too. Let me know if that is ok with you. 

 

Please let me know if you have any other query, will try my best to response to you promptly.

 

Thank you so much

 

Cheers,

Eng Ying

  Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter

 

 ,

 

How are you and so happy to hear from you! 

 

I would be delighted for you to share your experience as a Freshmore student, can be anything really. Highlighted events, what you enjoy most in the first two terms (subject wise, the curriculum, SMT subject, schooling in the pandemic period etc, just some suggestion) and of course you can dedicate your words to F05 as well. 

 

Choose any style or format you want to present, the choice is yours :) The word limit is just an indication of how much we can fit into one page and send me the original photos, as many that you think can fit into one page including caption. We will revise your article on our side after your submission for your review as well. 

 

Feel free to email me if you have any further questions :)

 

Thank you once again and look forward to receive your article.

 

Best Regards,

Eng Ying 

 

 Student - Chua Yi Qi,  
 Tuesday, 24 August 2021 3:19 PM
 Bong Eng Ying <engying_bong@sutd.edu.sg <mailengying_bong@sutd.edu.sg> >
 Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter

 

Hi Eng Ying! 

 

Joseph shared with me regarding the SMT Newsletter, and I would love to be part of it! As the class will be split based on electives in Term 3, I was thinking of an article dedicating to F05 before we proceed to our new classes. However, I’m not sure if this topic would be possible. I could write about my Freshmore experience in general if you would prefer that as well. 

 

In addition, I saw the previous newsletter and noticed that some articles wrote from the 3rd POV while some used the Q&A method. Which kind of style should I be using? Apart from the 300 word limit, are there other restrictions like number of images and number of points I should be mentioning?

 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

 Chua

Subject: Invitation to ESD Pillar Information Session (Fall 2021), 15 Sep 2021, 3.30pm (via Zoom)
Body:
All, 

 

Welcome back, hope it was a good term break for everyone. 😊 

 

You will be choosing your pillar of study very soon and to prepare you for making this important decision, we would like to invite you to an Information Session on the Engineering Systems and Design (ESD) Pillar on 15 September 2021 (Wednesday), 3.30pm to 5.30pm on Zoom.  

 

At this information session, you will learn more about ESD. You will also meet our ESD alumni and their managers to hear about their working experiences and views about ESD Programme.

 

To register for the event, please scan the QR code below or alternately, click this link <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FmYkKd6YTLs&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C97615bbf736545ab282208d96b58cfb8%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637658851540944640%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=yQ7M9y9yYLFywowGt8cG35b2faYxd2ccxYkiNMjAQA0%3D&reserved=0> . 		  Application for SUTD BIG Analyst

		 

		External Email – Do not click on any links or open any attachments from an unknown sender.

		 

		Hi candidate,  you still have two more days to submit your case responses.

		 

		Do note that failure to do so would imply that your candidature / application will be disqualified. 

		 

		Thanks for reading and hope to receive your responses soon.

		 

		Best regards,

		Managing Team (DPK Partners)

		 

		On Sat, Aug 21, 2021, 22:51 SUTD BizSoc <sutdbizsoc@gmail.com <mailsutdbizsoc@gmail.com> > wrote:

			Hi , congratulations on being selected to move on to the next round of the assessment process!  

			 

			In this round, you will be required to complete two case studies (as attached) by 29/8/21 23:59.

			 

			If you have any enquiries with regards to the case studies, do feel free to respond to this email and we will get back to you within 2 business days. 

			 

			All the best and we look forward to receiving your case responses !

			 

			Best regards,

			Dallion (Managing Partner)

			D.P.K. Partners (Former SUTD Business Society)

			 

			On Mon, Jul 12, 2021, 01:35 Student - Chua Yi Qi,  <_chua@mymail.sutd.edu.sg <mail_chua@mymail.sutd.edu.sg> > wrote:

				Hello! 

				 

				First of all, I would like to apologize sincerely for sending this application late as I was considering really thoroughly. After much thought, I decided that I would like to join this program and thus applying for it, which links me to the first question. Hope you would still give this application a read, thank you!

				 

				1.Why do you want to join the program? (Max 100 words) 

				14 months ago, I was hesitating between SMU Business and SUTD. Though coming into SUTD is a great decision, there's still some regret in me for not studying business. As such, I'm intending to pursue a business-related Masters's instead. Filled with lots of great resources, like mentorship and the opportunity to work on case studies, this program is one step closer to my dream and fulfilling it earlier. So, why not? University to me is about self-exploration and preparing me for the real world ahead. I genuinely hope to be enrolled in this to enrich my learning journey in SUTD. 

				 

				2.What career do you wish to pursue? (Max 100 words)

				To be very truthful, I don't have a specific answer as I'm not sure what lies ahead of me. However, the concept of Artificial Intelligence and Big Data attracts me and I'm intending to pursue a degree in DAI or ESD. Subsequently, I may find a career related to Business analytic, AI-related developer, or designer. Once, I read about specialists vs generalists. Greedy as I am, I wish for myself to be a 'T-shaped' person, one filled with the breadth of knowledge and depth of expertise. On top of learning new skills, I wish to be enrolled in this program.

				 

				Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to read this and hope to hear from you soon 🙂

				 

				Yours sincerely, 

				 Chua 

				Telegram handle: @_chua

				Instagram handle: @_fatqi

Subject: [Virtual FACT 2021 - DTIxSZTU] Shared Folder for Presentation Materials & Zoom Breakout Room Recordings
Body:
Hi Everyone,

 

I have created a shared folder HERE <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsutdapac-my.sharepoint.com%2F%3Af%3A%2Fg%2Fpersonal%2Ftszwing_law_sutd_edu_sg%2FEjpMeJweoKZJlnzRd-GrfYYBuO86Yb4nroLkkO9_oeC6ZQ%3Fe%3DzZ9Qmw&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C9a3a264c770d4323027208d96d2cad20%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637660860909880633%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sDY%2Fd6w2SHtiut2qs%2BZLSoP7VPISjtgF0SEf8yXgvCs%3D&reserved=0>  for me to share materials from Prof Arlindo (if any) with you, and for you to drop the Zoom Breakout Room recordings.

 

We would require assistance to record whenever the teams are in Breakout Rooms. The Zoom recordings do take a while to convert if the recording is too long, so a suggestion would be to stop the recording during your lunch/dinner breaks and resume recording during the discussions.

 

I will be recording the main Zoom room lectures, hence you are not required to record during those times.

 

Do feel free to let me know if there are any issues accessing the link, or if there are any questions. I must apologize that there has been some hiccups/last min changes today as we started Day 1 of this virtual programme.. I hope everyone is able to have fun and enjoy the rest of the programme in the next 3 days. 😊

 

Regards,

Dorothy

Office of International Relations

Singapore University of Technology and Design
