Subject: House Guardians: Housing Offer for Term Stay AY2021 [Sarah Chua (1005522)]
Body:
Chua (1005522), 

In line with your appointment as a House Guardian, we are pleased to offer you accommodation as follows:

 

*	Check-in date: 12 September 2021 
*	Check-out date: 20 August 2022, 9.00am -11.00am
*	Offered accommodation: single room
*	Maximum occupancy: applicant only 

 

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

 

Please ensure you read through the attached document carefully for more information related to the prevailing Stay-Home Notice and self-isolation/Leave of Absence requirements if you are returning from overseas. 

 

During your stay in the hostel:

 

a.    You are expected to comply with any COVID-19 related instructions from the university (e.g. self-isolating within the hostel for a specific period of time, undergoing swabbing or other medical tests within the University or outside) as part of the University’s safe management measures should the need arise.

 

b.    You agree to undergo any COVID-19 related tests whenever specified by the University from time to time, with the understanding that the University will make every effort to minimize any expenses you need to incur. You agree that the university can terminate your housing agreement if you fail to comply with these agreements.

 

c.   This housing offer may be withdrawn if there are new developments imposed by the Singapore Government or decisions undertaken by the University that impact the hostel.  If this happens, the Office of Housing will try its best to provide as much advance notice as possible.  Please check your SUTD emails (if matriculated) or personal emails regularly.  Do also ensure that your Singapore mobile number (if any) is updated in MyPortal <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/>  in case we need to reach you urgently.

 

Due to the dynamic COVID-19 global situation, the information above is subject to change.  

 

OTHER POINTS TO NOTE

 

1)    This housing offer is contingent on your continued appointment as a House Guardian during the stipulated stay period indicated above.  Should your appointment cease, this housing offer may be withdrawn.

 

2)    Please be aware of the total cost of your stay and any other important information before accepting the housing offer.  Utilities charges are included in the offer of housing except for the room’s air-conditioning which is on a pay-per-use basis.  In addition, a list of housing-related fees and charges is attached (subject to change; the latest version can be found at https://tinyurl.com/officeofhousing <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fofficeofhousing&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C47b9f77481cc4780b40908d96d20d8f8%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637660810133025200%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=DbHSi1o0h2duy8aEDtuxIDLtA2BON52MpCYR1pO1DxE%3D&reserved=0> ). 

 

3)    Housing fees are invoiced on a term basis; refer to https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Campus-Life/Housing <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Campus-Life/Housing>  for the billing schedule.  The first bill is invoiced upon check-in.  Payment is due 7 days from the invoice date. Late fees of $20 may be billed should payment be outstanding after each payment deadline. All fees paid are non-refundable.

 

4)    You are expected to familiarise yourself with the Student Housing Terms and Conditions. Please refer to the attachment (subject to change; the latest version will be found at https://tinyurl.com/officeofhousing <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fofficeofhousing&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C47b9f77481cc4780b40908d96d20d8f8%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637660810133035197%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=laJzpEMKwthkkT0dzP9Vqr4FF%2FZKsmSnHwHKEaYgJcQ%3D&reserved=0> , which requires login into your student account).      

 

5)    The University reserves the right to withdraw this offer if you had breached the Student Housing Terms and Conditions or any other rules and regulations imposed by SUTD, or failed to pay your housing fees by the stipulated deadlines.

 

 


ACCEPTING THE HOUSING OFFER


 


1.    Acceptance period: From now to 5 September 2021

 

2.    How to accept: reply to this email within the acceptance period to confirm your acceptance of the housing offer

 

By accepting the housing offer, you are deemed to have acknowledged and agreed to all the points above and the Housing Terms and Conditions, as well as any other hostel rules and regulations that may be implemented by the University from time to time.

 

 

For queries, please write to ecchousing@sutd.edu.sg <mailecchousing@sutd.edu.sg> .  

 

 

Thank you.

 

Regards,

Office of Housing

Hooray! You guys are the best class and congratulations on winning the best class spirit award and thank you on behalf of the class for writing up the submission :) And I think your article came at the perfect timing to commemorate F05. The video is so cute, love seeing everyone faces there.

Unfortunately for the first 2 term, 3.007 course is not part of SMT. I include the link here for your reference: https://smt.sutd.edu.sg/education/undergraduate/courses/. Since your article will be published in SMT newsletter, I thought it will be nice (if any) to showcase any SMT relevant subjects or faculty too? This is just my opinion so that your experience is share at the right platform. I will help you check if your message to 3.007 course and faculty could be publish in another newsletter. I am sure they will be more than happy to have your experience share there too. Let me know if that is ok with you.

Thank you so much

 

Cheers,

  Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter

 

 ,

 

How are you and so happy to hear from you! 

 

I would be delighted for you to share your experience as a Freshmore student, can be anything really. Highlighted events, what you enjoy most in the first two terms (subject wise, the curriculum, SMT subject, schooling in the pandemic period etc, just some suggestion) and of course you can dedicate your words to F05 as well. 

 

Choose any style or format you want to present, the choice is yours :) The word limit is just an indication of how much we can fit into one page and send me the original photos, as many that you think can fit into one page including caption. We will revise your article on our side after your submission for your review as well. 

 

Feel free to email me if you have any further questions :)

 

Thank you once again and look forward to receive your article.

 

Best Regards,

Eng Ying

 Tuesday, 24 August 2021 3:19 PM
 Bong Eng Ying <engying_bong@sutd.edu.sg <mailengying_bong@sutd.edu.sg> >
 Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter

 

Hi Eng Ying! 

 

Joseph shared with me regarding the SMT Newsletter, and I would love to be part of it! As the class will be split based on electives in Term 3, I was thinking of an article dedicating to F05 before we proceed to our new classes. However, I’m not sure if this topic would be possible. I could write about my Freshmore experience in general if you would prefer that as well. 

 

In addition, I saw the previous newsletter and noticed that some articles wrote from the 3rd POV while some used the Q&A method. Which kind of style should I be using? Apart from the 300 word limit, are there other restrictions like number of images and number of points I should be mentioning?

 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

 Chua

Please let me know if you have any other query, will try my best to response to you promptly.

 

Thank you so much

 

Cheers,

Eng Ying

  Sharing of Freshmore Experience on SMT Newsletter

 

 ,

 

How are you and so happy to hear from you! 

 

I would be delighted for you to share your experience as a Freshmore student, can be anything really. Highlighted events, what you enjoy most in the first two terms (subject wise, the curriculum, SMT subject, schooling in the pandemic period etc, just some suggestion) and of course you can dedicate your words to F05 as well. 

 

Choose any style or format you want to present, the choice is yours :) The word limit is just an indication of how much we can fit into one page and send me the original photos, as many that you think can fit into one page including caption. We will revise your article on our side after your submission for your review as well. 

 

Feel free to email me if you have any further questions :)

 

Thank you once again and look forward to receive your article.

 

Best Regards,

Eng Ying

Hi Eng Ying! 

 

Joseph shared with me regarding the SMT Newsletter, and I would love to be part of it! As the class will be split based on electives in Term 3, I was thinking of an article dedicating to F05 before we proceed to our new classes. However, I’m not sure if this topic would be possible. I could write about my Freshmore experience in general if you would prefer that as well. 

 

In addition, I saw the previous newsletter and noticed that some articles wrote from the 3rd POV while some used the Q&A method. Which kind of style should I be using? Apart from the 300 word limit, are there other restrictions like number of images and number of points I should be mentioning?

 

Thank you!

 

Yours sincerely,

Subject: Billing of fridge fee for September 2021 term
Body:
[You may ignore this email if you do not have a fridge and do not plan to use a fridge in the new term]

 

 Residents, 

 

Please be informed that the fee for the usage of the fridge in the room for September 2021 term will be billed on 13 September 2021 (Mon).

 

Please take note of the following:

 

Registration of Fridge for new fridge users by 10 September 2021 (Fri), 5 pm

 

To register, please log in to the housing portal -> click on the Maintenance tab -> click 'Create a New Job' -> Select ‘item request’ -> Select ‘Registration of 50L/100L fridge’ -> Submit by clicking on ‘Save and Continue’

 

Please click here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/ap/b-59584e83/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsutdapac-my.sharepoint.com%2F%3Ab%3A%2Fg%2Fpersonal%2Fecchousing_sutd_edu_sg%2FETtRBcKpOPxEvT4JrWrGvJYBh1BhhcbhnbZIh04sV5a2Ig%3Fe%3DXPNvCS&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd896dc93f1964078a80208d96df67648%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637661727576943508%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=jparUFfm3TRexcKbjl5dQhyHPXQHj1cEYI32CMoPCoM%3D&reserved=0>  to view the requirements for using a fridge in the accommodation and the amount to be paid.

 

Note: 

 

- If you had moved to another room this term (May 2021), you are required to submit a new registration as the registration for the previous room will not be carried over to the new room. As for those who remained in the same room and had registered previously, you are not required to re-register if you are continuing to use the fridge in the same room for the new term 

 

De-registration of Fridge by 10 September 2021 (Fri), 5 pm

 

If you had registered your fridge during the previous term(s) via the housing portal and not planning to use the fridge in the new term, please de-register your fridge by logging in to the housing portal -> click on maintenance tab -> click on 'Create a New Job' -> select ‘item request’ -> ‘Deregistration of Fridge’ -> Submit by clicking on ‘Save and Continue’. We will proceed to bill the fridge fee should there be no de-registration submitted by the stipulated date given.

 

Should you have any queries or require any assistance, please feel free to contact us.

 

Thank you.

 

 

Regards,

Office of Housing

 

Block 59, #01-91

Changi South Avenue 1, Singapore 485999  

Website: www.sutd.edu.sg <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sutd.edu.sg%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd896dc93f1964078a80208d96df67648%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637661727576953503%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vUyYx2oSv%2FELl5IW0iWFjZEPDo3DjI6cpT4c6vkWvyE%3D&reserved=0>

 House Guardians: Housing Offer for Term Stay AY2021 [ Chua (1005522)] 

 

  Chua (1005522), 

In line with your appointment as a House Guardian, we are pleased to offer you accommodation as follows:

 

*	Check-in date: 12 September 2021 
*	Check-out date: 20 August 2022, 9.00am -11.00am
*	Offered accommodation: single room
*	Maximum occupancy: applicant only 

 

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

 

Please ensure you read through the attached document carefully for more information related to the prevailing Stay-Home Notice and self-isolation/Leave of Absence requirements if you are returning from overseas. 

 

During your stay in the hostel:

 

a.    You are expected to comply with any COVID-19 related instructions from the university (e.g. self-isolating within the hostel for a specific period of time, undergoing swabbing or other medical tests within the University or outside) as part of the University’s safe management measures should the need arise.

 

b.    You agree to undergo any COVID-19 related tests whenever specified by the University from time to time, with the understanding that the University will make every effort to minimize any expenses you need to incur. You agree that the university can terminate your housing agreement if you fail to comply with these agreements.

 

c.   This housing offer may be withdrawn if there are new developments imposed by the Singapore Government or decisions undertaken by the University that impact the hostel.  If this happens, the Office of Housing will try its best to provide as much advance notice as possible.  Please check your SUTD emails (if matriculated) or personal emails regularly.  Do also ensure that your Singapore mobile number (if any) is updated in MyPortal <https://myportal.sutd.edu.sg/>  in case we need to reach you urgently.

 

Due to the dynamic COVID-19 global situation, the information above is subject to change.  

 

OTHER POINTS TO NOTE

 

1)    This housing offer is contingent on your continued appointment as a House Guardian during the stipulated stay period indicated above.  Should your appointment cease, this housing offer may be withdrawn.

 

2)    Please be aware of the total cost of your stay and any other important information before accepting the housing offer.  Utilities charges are included in the offer of housing except for the room’s air-conditioning which is on a pay-per-use basis.  In addition, a list of housing-related fees and charges is attached (subject to change; the latest version can be found at https://tinyurl.com/officeofhousing <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fofficeofhousing&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C869e57583d6b4ffde28908d96dcd8af1%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637661551904903189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=okl4UD5hIUIa6m1pybZ6b2YHqo3NtLnDLcQkElFYZDU%3D&reserved=0> ). 

 

3)    Housing fees are invoiced on a term basis; refer to https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Campus-Life/Housing <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Campus-Life/Housing>  for the billing schedule.  The first bill is invoiced upon check-in.  Payment is due 7 days from the invoice date. Late fees of $20 may be billed should payment be outstanding after each payment deadline. All fees paid are non-refundable.

 

4)    You are expected to familiarise yourself with the Student Housing Terms and Conditions. Please refer to the attachment (subject to change; the latest version will be found at https://tinyurl.com/officeofhousing <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftinyurl.com%2Fofficeofhousing&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C869e57583d6b4ffde28908d96dcd8af1%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637661551904913178%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Iy8UsAcZrPJsy9rstJDubfqlIyfVeOG%2Fi18YbsEarNg%3D&reserved=0> , which requires login into your student account).      

 

5)    The University reserves the right to withdraw this offer if you had breached the Student Housing Terms and Conditions or any other rules and regulations imposed by SUTD, or failed to pay your housing fees by the stipulated deadlines.

 

 


ACCEPTING THE HOUSING OFFER


 


1.    Acceptance period: From now to 5 September 2021

 

2.    How to accept: reply to this email within the acceptance period to confirm your acceptance of the housing offer

 

By accepting the housing offer, you are deemed to have acknowledged and agreed to all the points above and the Housing Terms and Conditions, as well as any other hostel rules and regulations that may be implemented by the University from time to time.

 

 

For queries, please write to ecchousing@sutd.edu.sg <mailecchousing@sutd.edu.sg> .  

 

 

Thank you.

 

Regards,

Office of Housing

Subject: [Virtual FACT 2021 - DTIxSZTU] Shared Folder for Presentation Materials & Zoom Breakout Room Recordings
Body:
Hello Everyone,

 

Well done on your presentations today! I think you guys and your SZTU friends deserves a big round of applause after 4 days of hard work 👍 (<- I don’t know if you see it, but there is a thumbs up emoji here)

 

To the students who have been helping to record the Breakout Room sessions, thank you for your assistance thus far! Do continue to drop the recordings in the <2. Breakout Room Recordings> folder if there are any that has not been shared.

 

We have also uploaded some group photos and screenshots during your presentations in our < 3. Photos (Day 4) > folder. Please feel free to share any pictures/screenshots too!

 [Virtual FACT 2021 - DTIxSZTU] Shared Folder for Presentation Materials & Zoom Breakout Room Recordings

 

Hi Everyone,

 

I have created a shared folder HERE <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsutdapac-my.sharepoint.com%2F%3Af%3A%2Fg%2Fpersonal%2Ftszwing_law_sutd_edu_sg%2FEjpMeJweoKZJlnzRd-GrfYYBuO86Yb4nroLkkO9_oeC6ZQ%3Fe%3DzZ9Qmw&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cd4a1926957ee40a38aef08d96f8fbd02%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637663485408497034%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=xrZHWXtQZBbRQ1Lzti76AhSnTHlQ%2Fdc7z8c%2B%2BvzsJeY%3D&reserved=0>  for me to share materials from Prof Arlindo (if any) with you, and for you to drop the Zoom Breakout Room recordings.

 

We would require assistance to record whenever the teams are in Breakout Rooms. The Zoom recordings do take a while to convert if the recording is too long, so a suggestion would be to stop the recording during your lunch/dinner breaks and resume recording during the discussions.

 

I will be recording the main Zoom room lectures, hence you are not required to record during those times.

 

Do feel free to let me know if there are any issues accessing the link, or if there are any questions. I must apologize that there has been some hiccups/last min changes today as we started Day 1 of this virtual programme.. I hope everyone is able to have fun and enjoy the rest of the programme in the next 3 days. 😊

 

Regards,

Dorothy

Office of International Relations

Singapore University of Technology and Design

 

 Dorothy Law

 Come join us at LCC 2021! 
 
 SUTD community, 



SUTD's annual Learning Celebration Carnival (LCC) event is right around the corner!

 

LCC is an event where our students can share their experiential learning journeys and showcase their innovations from various programmes, held over the year, with the SUTD family.

 

This year, LCC will follow a hybrid format - physical exhibition and virtually on YouTube, Gather Town and Website and is held on two separate days – 29 September, Wednesday and 01 October, Friday with a refreshed format.

 

What can you expect?

1.	Poster exhibition (Internships, UROP, Special Projects (5th Row) and Overseas Opportunity) held in the campus centre
2.	Keynote addresses, including from external speakers Tan Shao Yen (Group Chief Innovation Officer, CPG Corporation) and Yvonne Tan (Digital Motor Senior Engineering Manager, Dyson)
3.	12 livestreamed talks covering topics such as software engineering, product design, AI and more
4.	Online poster gallery consisting of various posters showcasing internships, UROPs, overseas opportunities, and special projects
5.	*NEW this year* Gather Town Exhibition - interact with our student presenters! 

 

You will also get a chance to vote for your favourite posters. The top posters will win attractive prizes. The voting procedure will be shared later. 🗳

 

So, join us in this year’s very special LCC!

 

To find out more, visit the LCC website: lcc.sutd.edu.sg <https://lcc.sutd.edu.sg/> 


Best, 
Chen Qinyi

 <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 

Media and Marketing Director

9th Student Government

Unwavering • Accountable • Collaborative

Subject: eDimension and Blue Integration with EASE
Body:
Students,

 

This is a gentle reminder that you will be prompted for your EASE MFA in addition to your EASE ID and password when accessing eDimension and Blue (Subject and Instructor Evaluation). 

Please refer to the attached guides for your reference.

 

If you encounter any issue when accessing eDimension or Blue, please email to us at edi_admin@sutd.edu.sg <mailedi_admin@sutd.edu.sg> .

 

Regards,

eDimension Admin

 

 

 EDimension Admin 
 Monday, 23 August 2021 11:30 am
 EDimension Admin <edi_admin@sutd.edu.sg>
 eDimension and Blue Integration with EASE

 

 Students,

 

We are continuously improving the security of our Learning Systems to provide you with a safer cyber environment. We are pleased to announce that eDimension and Blue will be integrated with SUTD’s Enhanced Access and Secure Entry (EASE).

 

With this integration, Multifactor Authentication (MFA) will be used when accessing eDimension and Blue (Course Evaluation). 

 

From 30 Aug 2021 9:00 am, you will be prompted for your EASE MFA in addition to your EASE ID and password when accessing eDimension and Blue. 

 

Please refer to the attached guides for your reference.

 

If you encounter any issue when accessing eDimension and Blue, please email to us at edi_admin@sutd.edu.sg <mailedi_admin@sutd.edu.sg> .

 

Regards,

eDimension Admin

Subject: Invitation to ESD Pillar Information Session (Fall 2021), 15 Sep 2021, 3.30pm (via Zoom)
Body:
Term 3 Freshmores,

 

Wish to learn more about the career prospects of ESD graduates? 

 

Do join us at the ESD Pillar Info Session to learn more about ESD, and  hear from our alumni and their managers from Ernest and Young and Lazada.  

 

				
				
	
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


To register for the event, click here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FmYkKd6YTLs&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce15fcdfdfbce4fbf803c08d97400f5b9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637668369993214240%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=BUfFVAXkQkQQ%2FUcYHEk43LoBe%2F20BHsvqKS2TsII5fw%3D&reserved=0> . We hope to see you all at the info session.

 

 

Regards,
Lee Cheng

 

 

 Lim Lee Cheng 
 Monday, August 30, 2021 9:52 AM
 Lim Lee Chen <leechen_lim@sutd.edu.sg <mailleechen_lim@sutd.edu.sg> >
 Invitation to ESD Pillar Information Session (Fall 2021), 15 Sep 2021, 3.30pm (via Zoom)

 

 All, 

 

Welcome back, hope it was a good term break for everyone. 😊 

 

You will be choosing your pillar of study very soon and to prepare you for making this important decision, we would like to invite you to an Information Session on the Engineering Systems and Design (ESD) Pillar on 15 September 2021 (Wednesday), 3.30pm to 5.30pm on Zoom.  

 

At this information session, you will learn more about ESD. You will also meet our ESD alumni and their managers to hear about their working experiences and views about ESD Programme.

 

To register for the event, please scan the QR code below or alternately, click this link <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FmYkKd6YTLs&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce15fcdfdfbce4fbf803c08d97400f5b9%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637668369993224231%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=dEz2frYFeJG22jwGN90MkA9F0WD3Mi7DHR%2FZCON7pV0%3D&reserved=0> . Subject: [For SUTD] Exclusive Invitation to Ministry of Foreign Affairs Networking Session - September 2021
Body:
· Networking Session 2021 ·

A Foreign Service career is more than just a job.

If you are interested to be on the frontline of global developments and diplomatic negotiations to safeguard and advance Singapore's interests, or if you are keen to manage core functions which include assisting overseas Singaporeans in distress and facilitating formalities and courtesies, a career at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs as a Foreign Service Officer may be right for you.

With over 50 Overseas Missions, being part of the Foreign Service offers unparalleled opportunities and rewards. Depending on your competencies, your career can develop along the Functional and Corporate or Political and Economic track. 



 

 

· What to Expect ·

 

With the valuable opportunity to hear from and network with our Foreign Service Officers, the networking session is a platform for interested students to get a better understanding of MFA’s work and the challenges of working in the Foreign Service.

 

    

 

· Event Details ·

 

Date:        Thursday, 16 September 2021
Time:        2.30pm to 4.30pm
Platform:  Zoom

RSVP by 13 September 2021

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgo.gov.sg%2Fmfa-septnetworkingsession-21&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C1b2ce1cb4eb9469f11b108d9737dd495%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637667806598532360%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ePfg0aCN%2Fd8z%2BA5GTzFX4%2FPy18unGt%2Fy9NkNZUNpinQ%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: Invitation to Supply Chain Hackathon 2021 supported by YCH - Apply by 20 Sept 2021
Body:
The Young SEAkers is proud to announce that we will be hosting the first-of-its-kind Supply Chain Hackathon <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Ftyshacksite&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ca53f3e5e5692409f136508d97379ed65%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637667789837315406%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=aifbm163E11gx9Rk66IuH5HKUeFRf3Kg5qgf9%2FqRxBc%3D&reserved=0>  supported by YCH, Singapore's largest home-grown supply chain solutions company, and it is our pleasure to invite your students to be a part of this Hackathon. 

 

ABOUT THE YOUNG SEAKERS (TYS)

The Young SEAkers is the first and only Southeast-Asia based non-profit with a China and ASEAN angle. We aspire to bring together vibrant, competent ASEAN youths who are passionate about advancing the ASEAN-China region. Headquartered in Singapore, The Young SEAkers is currently in the process of setting up regional chapters across all 10 ASEAN countries.

 

ABOUT YCH GROUP

YCH is Singapore’s largest home-grown supply chain solutions company and leading regional supply chain management partner to many of the world’s leading brands across Asia Pacific.

 

We believe this is a great opportunity for students to gain exposure and new insights into the supply chain industry. Winning teams will stand a chance to win an employment opportunity with YCH, including the YCH Management Associate Programme placement for top prize winners, Fast-track Internship offer and Winter Immersion Programme for runner-ups.

 

The timeline of the hackathon is as follows: 

*	​Registration: OPEN
*	​Registration Deadline: 20th September 
*	​Participant Shortlisting: 24th September
*	​Hackathon: 1st to 3rd October

For more information, kindly refer to our website <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Ftyshacksite&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ca53f3e5e5692409f136508d97379ed65%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637667789837325399%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NsEIztMSfte4WHGpRiZgt20dEUzgsx%2F6enpnRvSHQY0%3D&reserved=0> . Please reach out to us at hackathon@theyoungseakers.com <mailhackathon@theyoungseakers.com>  if you have any questions or if you need any additional information. 

 

Thank you! 

 

Cheers,

 

Davina Tham
Employer Relations
Career Development Centre

Subject: EY - Upcoming Career Workshops - Personal Brand and Workplace Readiness
Body:
Hope you’re well! 

EY is having some upcoming workshops and will like to invite you to join! 

 

Personal Brand Workshop

Date: Tuesday, 21 September 2021
Time: 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m.

Brand image. Brand awareness. Brand affinity. If you think these concepts are relevant only to corporations, think again, because a strong brand can do for you what it does for them: to differentiate you from your closest competitors, increase visibility, enhance credibility and more. You have experiences to share and goals to achieve. Let us help you build your brand identity for today’s digital world.

 

Workplace readiness workshop
Date: Thursday, 23 September 2021
Time: 11:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m.

GPA? Pass. Technical excellence? Check. Workplace readiness, resilience and emotional intelligence? Wait a second – how do employers assess that, and how do you make sure you’re ready? In this workplace readiness workshop, join us for a candid discussion about the soft skills that will equip you to thrive in the workplace. From stress management to future readiness, gain insights into the traits that make for productive employees and effective teams, help accelerate career progression and which are most desired by employers.

 

Register he https://forms.office.com/r/Zhk3g963wU <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FZhk3g963wU&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C289615f9e4814c5e850808d97377f913%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637667783045587242%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sjt4FOnaufjNT8k%2BD6PGafn6w0LVfv9MXOjT9yaa%2F%2Bc%3D&reserved=0> 

 


Regards,

Subject: DBS Virtual Seminar: Take Charge of Your Financial Wellness
Body:
Yo SUTDents!


Have you always wondered how you are going to budget and save your money when you are university? How you should grow your money while you are studying? Look no further! MarketWatch has partnered with DBS to offer SUTDents various sessions to take charge of their own finances. In our first session, we will be exploring the topic of budgeting, various money saving tips and DBS NAV Planner to track your own financial goals. More details can be found in the poster below and we hope to see you all there!

Date: 23 September 2021 (Thurs) 
Time: 6pm-7pm

To register for the webinar, scan the QR code in the poster or click here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgo.dbs.com%2Fssmcsep21&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cb64aec38d9424430602e08d973527692%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637667620525400997%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=L%2F%2BKkQZch54lsCYV%2BjLqqAi0iXiJSeoTpF%2BJRvXI86k%3D&reserved=0> .






Thank you!



Best Regards,
SUTD MarketWatch Exco Team

Subject: Adobe Photoshop Webinar Invitation: A little Creative Cloud with your lunch
Body:
Students, 

Adobe would like to invite you to attend a webinar on Adobe Photoshop. If you are interested, please click on the link below to register.


 

	





 

	
	

A little Creative Cloud with your lunch

	
			

 

	

Join us for lunch and learn how to use Photoshop for everyday tasks.

Don’t worry if you have never used it before, we will hold your hand and get you started straight away.

 

During the 90 minute session you will learn how to combine several images together, add text and effects, and save the image to use in your work. 

This is a hands on session so we will provide you with the images that you will need to play along. 

 

All you need to do is install Photoshop from your corporate account first, open it, download the images from the link below, and bring your lunch.

	

Preparation

1.	Install Photoshop from your Company account using the instructions below.
2.	Open Photoshop to make sure you are logged in.
3.	Download the images from  <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fshared-assets.adobe.com%2Flink%2F00737a9b-eb19-4d99-4b71-f09df0d31d41&data=04%7C01%7Ckenneth_quek%40sutd.edu.sg%7C4c5aa6627ecb4e50be1c08d97294f4ba%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806344482749%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Rkxy%2FcWqtjnvoXF2UZQdn%2BqRWhgkso%2B%2Fm1swebwP33o%3D&reserved=0> here
4.	Bring your lunch!

 

 

Guide for installing and launching Adobe Photoshop (if not installed already)

1.	Click on the  <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcreativecloud.adobe.com%2Fapps%2Fall%2Fdesktop%3Faction%3Dinstall%26source%3Dapps%26productId%3Dcreative-cloud&data=04%7C01%7Ckenneth_quek%40sutd.edu.sg%7C4c5aa6627ecb4e50be1c08d97294f4ba%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806344492709%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=2Vh8%2BogS0%2FmDhRUvmRfdtuYnikpL0mnZwKTg6GWTiw8%3D&reserved=0> link  <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcreativecloud.adobe.com%2Fapps%2Fall%2Fdesktop%3Faction%3Dinstall%26source%3Dapps%26productId%3Dcreative-cloud&data=04%7C01%7Ckenneth_quek%40sutd.edu.sg%7C4c5aa6627ecb4e50be1c08d97294f4ba%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806344502673%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UBuM58iGne7so8%2FFViFuh2J4ghq0Mx%2FjHoi8vPfCTYo%3D&reserved=0> here and sign in with your official email address and password: 

a.	If you are given options to choose between Company/School Account and Personal Account, please select Company/School Account
b.	It will download Creative Cloud Desktop Application on your machine
c.	If you do not have option for Company/School account and you do not remember the password, please click on “Reset your Password” link.

2.	Open Creative Cloud Desktop Application (and login again, if prompted)

a.	Locate Adobe Photoshop and click on Install Button

2.	Open Adobe Photoshop to ensure it is up and running before the session


Agenda


Date: 21st September 2021, Tuesday


Time: 1230 pm – 2 pm SGT

	

 

	
 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FB7AbtGGP2q&data=04%7C01%7Ckenneth_quek%40sutd.edu.sg%7C4c5aa6627ecb4e50be1c08d97294f4ba%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806344502673%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=f5%2FII4SsxDF%2FdufplmRHtCo7%2BLh9D9zwv2ZLDdOVbBk%3D&reserved=0> 

	

 

 



 


Speaker/Presenter details: 

	



Paul Burnett
Principal Evangelist, Creative Cloud, Adobe APAC

 

 

 


Paul is a Principal Evangelist for Creative Cloud in APAC. Before Adobe, Paul ran his own Design, Web and Video Company MAD - Multimedia Art Design for many years, and also worked as the Senior APAC Evangelist for Macromedia. With over 20 years’ experience in the industry, Paul believes that clean, simple design, engaging interactivity, and creativity make for a great user experience.

 

 


 


Michael Stoddart has been part of Adobe’s engagement with the Asia Pacific creative, marketing, design and design industry for over twenty years – leveraging his expertise from a variety of roles over that time

 

Initially trained in design, Michael supports industry’s adoption of a new wave of creative content technology. Michael is a spokesperson and thought leader for Adobe, at both its own marketing and creative events, as well as within various industry communities and activities.

	




Michael Stoddart
Dir, Strategic Business Development Enterprise Offerings

Adobe APAC 


	

 

	

  <https://landing.adobe.com/dam/global/images/adobe-logo.classic.160x222.png>

Subject: Datatu IntelliBrush
Body:
Hi,

 

Welcome, Datature’s latest product IntelliBrush!

 

	


 

The game has changed for image labelling with our latest AI-assisted Labelling Tool, IntelliBrush. 

Achieve pixel-perfect mask outlines by simply selecting regions that are in or out of interest. Intellibrush is industry agnostic and works on never-seen-before objects. Accelerate your team's labelling throughput while achieving perfectly labelled datasets. Schedule a demo here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcalendly.com%2Fkeechin%2Fideate&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C54eaace326594656e4f108d97294da28%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806668673265%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=q1LazsCH%2BjfJzFdh1KHy694s45J7CrVcsAiOnE634bc%3D&reserved=0> .

 





 

If you are a researcher, startup, or developer that might benefit from a collaborative, AI-enabled method of labelling datasets. Sign up for our IntelliBrush Early Access on the main page by leaving your email and we will get in touch shortly.

 

Request Early Access <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdatature.io%2F&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C54eaace326594656e4f108d97294da28%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806668673265%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=p6qdT3UffGy1QMVHVpCf7SqZMbMm7QPuu1r5UqNtM0A%3D&reserved=0> 

 

	

 

New Features on Nexus

 




Improve Model Robustness with Inbuilt Augmentation Studio.


Nexus users can now interactively adjust augmentations strategies and check the output in real-time. Improve your model robustness with our > 25 differing augmentation-on-the-fly options.

 




Introducing Configuration Overview.


Nexus workflow editor now warns you in advance if certain parameters don't make sense. Workflow now comes with an Auto-Suggest Workflow that samples your annotations and suggests a training strategy automatically.

 


 

 

Datature Featured Articles

 

	

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Ftrain-visualize-and-inspect-computer-vision-models-on-a-no-code-mlops-platform-6e26ea9c6fef&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C54eaace326594656e4f108d97294da28%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806668683254%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Tf%2FIr6Kx4%2BeJak62oUpAIiLeHvv3%2BxgK1xiVcwo0aSM%3D&reserved=0> 

 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftowardsdatascience.com%2Fbest-platform-to-build-deep-learning-models-for-computer-vision-tasks-1c3cf2e0e303&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C54eaace326594656e4f108d97294da28%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637666806668683254%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=AoAcChWyRmoWjOxLUd3lytYPAGbdy64gx8ADrowvTGM%3D&reserved=0>

Subject: TikTok 2022 Singapore Campus Recruitment
Body:
Students, 

 

________________________________



 

Thinking about where to kickstart your career? Look no further as Singapore TikTok Campus Recruitment 2022 is now LIVE with exciting positions from both tech and business fields.

 

TikTok prides ourselves to be a company that champions diversity and fosters a culture of inclusion among our global teams. Our employees are empowered to own their ideas, build fast, explore outside their comfort zone and support one another in the process. 

This is what life at TikTok is all about!

 

Keen to learn more about our open positions?

Learn more about it here at 2022 Graduate Opportunities <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbytedance.feishu.cn%2Fdocs%2FdoccnuSk5jTtrar8cusNe4XfUPg&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C94f26cc5c1e74ac5616c08d971ae027a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637665814531396529%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=I%2FSZJWw1e0UvRDWk1yk5u%2BOrOPY4VetK0mDwkXtyv3w%3D&reserved=0>  or 2022 Internship Opportunities <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbytedance.feishu.cn%2Fdocs%2FdoccnhFYuO21dvlpC3ZVg4pTZ50&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C94f26cc5c1e74ac5616c08d971ae027a%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637665814531406519%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=AK6n%2FOJ8kt8dnoURDjq2NgepBfiP%2Fm7UJG5ZEVJo47s%3D&reserved=0> .

 

We look forward to your applications!

 



 

 

Regards,

Career Development Centre

Subject: PSC Scholarships (Mid-Term) and Master's Scholarships
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

<Sent on behalf of PSC Secretariat>

 

 Student,

 

Hello from the Public Service Commission (‘PSC’) Secretariat! 

 

The PSC has been awarding scholarships since 1961. Over the years, we have identified and groomed many talented young men and women with the passion and commitment to serve Singapore and Singaporeans.

 

We offer various scholarship schemes such as the PSC Scholarships (Mid-Term) and PSC Master’s Scholarships for undergraduates and recent graduates with no more than 3 years of working experience in the private/non-governmental sector. More information can be found in the enclosed PSC Scholarships Brochure.  

 

If you are a Singapore Citizen with outstanding leadership qualities, have strong commitment to serve the Singapore community and an interest to explore a Public Service career, we welcome you to attend the PSC Virtual Information Session to find out more about the opportunities available for holders of PSC Scholarship (Mid-Term) and PSC Master’s Scholarships. Besides, you will also have the chance to hear from senior officers from the various public agencies to gain insight into the various career pathways available in the Public Service.  

 

The PSC Scholarships Virtual Information Session will be held on 11 September 2021 from 10.00am to 5.30pm via Zoom. Do register for the session via the link here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgo.gov.sg%2Fmeis2021&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cc7422fbd306e4ad0b3e908d971ab70b5%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637665804172922263%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4TEDnplNek1E3PxUlpEWyzbw3hkept%2FtouwOv7gq8uk%3D&reserved=0>  or scan the QR code below! Registrations will close on 09 September 2021.

 

You can find more details of the programme below too.

 



For queries related to the PSC Scholarship (Mid-Term) and PSC Master’s Scholarship, you may write to psc@psd.gov.sg <mailpsc@psd.gov.sg> . For technical difficulties related to the registration for the 2021 PSC Scholarships Virtual Information Session, you may write to Brenda_SEE@psd.gov.sg <mailBrenda_SEE@psd.gov.sg> , Ryan_TAN@psd.gov.sg <mailRyan_TAN@psd.gov.sg>  or Nafisah_VIKNESH@psd.gov.sg <mailNafisah_VIKNESH@psd.gov.sg> . 

 

Thank you.

 

Regards,

	
Office of Student Administration

 

 <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/>

Subject: Global Exchange Programme (GEXP) 2022 - coming to you soon!
Body:
Term 3 Students,

 

Interested to spend a term at an overseas host university? We have 32 partner universities in 16 exciting destinations for you to choose from! 

 

 

About Global Exchange Programme (GEXP) 

 

To better the world, first see and experience the world!

 

GEXP provides SUTD undergraduates a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to experience an international education and cultural immersion. Offered students will be able to spend a term at one of our partner university worldwide after Term 5 (Fall Term) or Term 6 (Spring Term).

 

To live and study in another country is an exciting opportunity that promises a fulfilling and rewarding experience!

 

Online application is open to all Term 3 students in October and students will be informed via email. Stay tuned and look out for more email updates send by Office of International Relations in the coming weeks!

 

List of partner universities

 



 

 

Meanwhile, look us up below:

 

										
		 <mailglobal@sutd.edu.sg> 	
		 <https://wearesutd.sutd.edu.sg/category/exchange/global-exchange-programme/> 	
			 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fsutdglobal%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cc7ff1f72128946ad348308d9710d9383%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637665125578016521%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Sojap20WMrny7YRxeb5zWLvlrf3BlJjGJJ0IyoRRP60%3D&reserved=0> 	
	 <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/Global/Student-Exchange/Outbound> 			 <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x9Frk84kcFg&list=PLUWNY6Eg0rRI14AzewwRYMPZbI3ORaZyR> 	
	
	
	
 

 

 

 

 


Warmest regards, 

Office of International Relations 

Singapore University of Technology and Design

 

 <https://www.sutd.edu.sg/>

Subject: [Virtual FACT 2021 - DTIxSZTU] Evaluation Survey & Submission of Reflection
Body:
Students,

 

Evaluation Survey & Submission of Reflection

 

We have reached the end of our virtual FACT programme for ‘Design Thinking & Innovation @ Shenzhen Technology University (DTIxSZTU)’ and we hope everyone had an enjoyable & enriching time during the virtual programme!

 

The Office of International Relations would like to find out more about your experience during this virtual programme and has prepared an Evaluation Survey form for your response.

 

You will also be submitting your reflection quotation and photo (as listed in the To-do List for all participants) in this form.

 

Kindly submit your response via this link HERE <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FyBEX3i3vb1&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C8ebcdb93a23140f82cec08d970e22f1e%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637664939042001771%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Dv8ETTwvYQu3FOjvwNxWuTBfW1L0NddW5f4yqrq9q28%3D&reserved=0> .

 

We would appreciate your response by 13 Sep 2021 (Mon).

 

Please note: The Office of International Relations has prepared a Certificate of Achievement (jointly signed by SZTU and SUTD) for all participants of this virtual programme. We will send out another email regarding the collection of certificates.

 

Till we meet again, hope everyone stay safe and enjoy the rest of your vacation!

 

Regards,

Dorothy

 



Office of International Relations

Singapore University of Technology and Design

 [SUTD Virtual Event] DESIGN and AI in the DATA DRIVEN WORLD - 7 & 8 Sep 2021

 

 SUTD Freshmores (Class of 2024)

 

The Design and Artificial Intelligence (DAI) programme invites you to join us at this upcoming “DESIGN and AI in the DATA DRIVEN WORLD” virtual event that’s happening on 7 & 8 Sep 2021.

Come find out the potential of Design and AI! Listen to industry experts and gain hands-on experience in creating AI algorithms in our workshop. Take part in our challenge and win up to $1000 of shopping vouchers!! 

 

If you are unsure of what the DAI programme is about, this virtual event will actually give you a glimpse into what you'll learn in the DAI programme. :)

 

For virtual event's programme, speakers' profile, challenge terms and conditions, please visit: https://www.sutd.edu.sg/About/happenings/Events/2021/9/Design-and-AI-in-the-Data-Driven-World

Subject: 2021 September Term - 02.001 : Global Humanities: Literature, Philosophy, and Ethics_Zhenxing: Important!!! Class schedule for the first week of Global Humanities
Body:
Students, 

Welcome to the Global Humanities course. Welcome back to the SUTD campus.
Here are several important announcements, so please read them carefully and save this email.

Firstly, this weekly course is divided into two parts, a one-hour Lecture and a two-hour recitation.

Secondly, please log in to your E-dimension and download, read/watch everything in the Week 1 document by next Monday. These materials are highly important and will help you understand what humanities is.

Thirdly, the schedule for the first week of classes.



For term 3 students, the Monday Lecture is online; please watch the video in the E-dimension. Your first week of in-person recitation classes will be held at the following locations: 



Cohort 9

TT14 

Cohort 10/11

CC13

Cohort 8

CC12 

For Term 1 students, all of your classes are online, unless the University has made any changes. Tuesday lecture is online; please watch the video in the E-dimension. Here are the links for the weekly recitation class: 
Topic: Global Humanities(TERM 1 STUDENT ONLY )
Time: Sep 24, 2021 08:30 AM Singapore
        Every week on Fri, 12 occurrence(s)
        Sep 24, 2021 08:30 AM
        Oct 1, 2021 08:30 AM
        Oct 8, 2021 08:30 AM
        Oct 15, 2021 08:30 AM
        Oct 22, 2021 08:30 AM
        Oct 29, 2021 08:30 AM
        Nov 5, 2021 08:30 AM
        Nov 12, 2021 08:30 AM
        Nov 19, 2021 08:30 AM
        Nov 26, 2021 08:30 AM
        Dec 3, 2021 08:30 AM
        Dec 10, 2021 08:30 AM

Join Zoom Meeting
https://sutd-edu-sg.zoom.us/j/98354550525?pwd=ZTNmd3ZLWXZEdmt3Ny9LbnovSGhNUT09

Meeting ID: 983 5455 0525
Passcode: 224076

If you have any other inquiries, please let me know by email and I will get back to you as soon as I can. I look forward to meeting you all soon. Enjoy your weekend. 

Best,
Zhenxing Zhao

Looking forward to meeting you virtually soon on 15 Sep, and do keep a lookout (via the Floor Chat) for other exciting hostel events that are also lined up for Sep and Oct, like growing Microgreens indoors, ‘Favour A Neighbour’ (FAN) etc!

Yours sincerely,

Subject: (Invitation) The Young SEAkers (TYS) Supply Chain Hackathon 2021
Body:
SUTD Students,

 

We would like to share with you an invitation from The Young SEAkers (TYS) as they host the first-of-its-kind Supply Chain Hackathon supported by YCH, Singapore’s largest home-grown supply solutions company.

 

The Young SEAkers is proud to announce that they will be hosting the first-of-its-kind Supply Chain Hackathon supported by YCH, Singapore's largest home-grown supply chain solutions company and they would like to invite SUTD students to join them in this Hackathon.

 

It is a great opportunity for students to gain exposure to the industry and subject matter experts, as well as learn from other participants in the hackathon. 

 

Winning teams will stand a chance to win an employment opportunity with YCH, including the YCH Management Associate Programme placement for the grand champion. The top 3 teams will also earn a fast-track Internship offer in 2022 and Winter Immersion Programme happening in December 2021.

 

The timeline of the hackathon is as follows:  

·       Registration Deadline: 20th September 

·       Participant Shortlisting: 24th September

·       Hackathon: 1st to 3rd October

 

Students are encouraged to sign up by 20th September. 

 

Registration link: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/supply-chain-hackathon-2021-tickets-169450231203 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.sg%2Fe%2Fsupply-chain-hackathon-2021-tickets-169450231203&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C79870b5af1b14d30626a08d9744e9ff6%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637668703448639269%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PL2ubuUHJgBUdtq3ZoPrn2y3geTfJc4HwndltkpFJHY%3D&reserved=0> 

 

For more information, kindly refer to TYS’ website <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Ftyshacksite&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C79870b5af1b14d30626a08d9744e9ff6%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637668703448649265%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rKWfqfwP2VynGci7hfnAiJDhF8nT5ly1n%2FiX4LDzIUo%3D&reserved=0>  or check out the information in the image as attached. 

 

Feel free to reach out to TYS at hackathon@theyoungseakers.com <mailhackathon@theyoungseakers.com>  if there are any questions. 

 

 

Best Regards,

 

Office of International Relations 

Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)

Subject: Global Exchange Programme 2022 - Join us at the Information Booth (13 Sept to 1 Oct)!
Body:
Term 3 Students,

 

Interested to spend a term at an overseas host university? We have 33 partner universities in 17 exciting destinations for you to choose from! Join us at the Information Booth from 13 September to 1 October 2021 (details below).

 

 

About Global Exchange Programme (GEXP)

 

To better the world, first see and experience the world!

 

GEXP provides SUTD undergraduates a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to experience an international education and cultural immersion. Offered students will be able to spend a term at one of our partner university worldwide after Term 5 (Fall Term) or Term 6 (Spring Term).

 

To live and study in another country is an exciting opportunity that promises a fulfilling and rewarding experience!

 

Online application is open to all Term 3 students in October and students will be informed via email. Stay tuned and look out for more email updates send by Office of International Relations in the coming weeks!

 

Note: SUTD will continue to monitor the COVID-19 situation worldwide. Due to the unpredictability, Host University and/or SUTD reserves the right to cancel GEXP 2022 at any point of time. The decision will be final and students will continue their Term 6 studies in SUTD as usual. SUTD strongly encourages all students to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 before embarking on GEXP.

	
 

 



 

 

 



 

Meanwhile, look us up below:

 

										
		 <mailglobal@sutd.edu.sg> 	
		 <https://wearesutd.sutd.edu.sg/category/exchange/global-exchange-programme/> 	
			 <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.instagram.com%2Fsutdglobal%2F%3Fhl%3Den&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C8a74e8f10bb0414fcbba08d97442f724%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637668653362906410%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=w68G96UwaLtySkP%2Bix5Cvj9G%2FEPkv0xmnY8jEHhwdkg%3D&reserved=0>

Warmest regards, 

Office of International Relations

Subject: [Restricted] Seating Plan for Cohort 20F08
Body:
Message Classification: Restricted

 

 

 Students,

Welcome back to SUTD!

A collaborative and cooperative culture is one of the key traits that keep the SUTD community spirit strong. 

Cohort-based learning

In our cohort-based pedagogy that emphasises peer learning, you will continue to be assigned randomly to groups and work with new people.

Seating Plan

Term 3 starts on 13 September (Monday) and we would like to provide information of your seat number and seating plan.  Please refer to the attached PDF.

As part of the safe management measures, please minimise your interactions by working with the assigned group of no more than 5 persons and occupying the assigned seat for lessons. Please refer to other measures shared in the attached email: Notice for Students (26 August 2021).

Some of your cohort/group mates may not be able to join you at the start of the term as they are serving SHN or entering Singapore later. As their buddies, you can:

*	Provide the Affected International Students (AIS) with opportunities of digital socialisation inside and outside classroom (e.g. 5th row) to instil a sense of belonging and camaraderie 
*	Provide the AIS with peer support in learning 
*	Highlight potential issues/challenges encountered in group projects, if any to course instructors.

 

Thank you.

 

Best regards,

Office of Student Administration

 <file:///C:/Users/rueyshyong_lim/Documents/Documents/download>

Subject: SUTD Wellbeing Survey
Body:
Hi SUTDents! 👋



🎉🎉 HAPPY DAY 1 OF A NEW TERM!!  🎉🎉

To our term 3 and 6, Welcome back to SUTD!

and to our Term 1, Welcome to the start of a new chapter in life and the SUTD Family!

 

As always, ROOT loves to hear feedback from students to improve student life. 

Hence, together with management, we are inviting you to fill up our Wellbeing Survey on Academic Life & Campus Facilities. 

This also follows up to Spring 2021 DSM (Minutes released on 6th Aug 2021), you can also access it here <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdrive.google.com%2Ffile%2Fd%2F1ShFbnD_RFBAlYY9VqskMIHw4XGnOGj5B%2Fview&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Ce8d43d333c9f4c4bfc5408d97697d9e1%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637671217051746212%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=MVnCmuNohiHcgiqGRuhp4LrRo%2F%2BQUBekkiy2DQT4tGw%3D&reserved=0> .

 

As this is a long survey, 💵 we will be giving out GrabFood vouchers to 20 lucky winners.

Well-being Survey closes at 

📆 19th Sept 2021, 11.59pm.

 

🔗 tinyurl.com/SUTDWELLBEING2021

 

We look forward to hearing your honest feedback through the survey that enacts the change for the future batches of SUTD. 

Thank you!

 

On behalf of the 9th Student Government, ROOT

 

P.S. This survey is not open to Term 1 students. Don't worry, there will be many opportunities to voice out your feedback in the future, do keep a lookout for them.

P.P.S. For those who have filled it up, you are automatically in the run, you do not have resubmit a new response. 

 



 

Best Regards,

 

Mohamad Arshad

 <https://root.sutd.edu.sg/> 

President

9th Student Government

Unwavering • Accountable • Collaborative

Subject: [HG Newsletters] Issue 1: Welcome to Hostel
Body:
Hello Residents!

Hope that the first day of the term went well for all of you! 2 groups to be addressed here…

First, the Term 1 Freshmores and new Graduate residents! A warm welcome to SUTD residential life! We hope that you will feel right at home here and enjoy the hostel activities we have lined up for you. Next, the returning Freshmores (Term 3) and pillar-year students (Term 6)! Glad to have you back with us again!

From this term onwards, the House Guardians will be sending e-newsletters once every 2 months or so to keep you informed of hostel events and happenings. The newsletters will also contain snippets of information on interesting or good-to-know topics, like holiday festivals, recipes, mental health awareness etc.

The 1st edition is attached. In this email, we’ve also attached a poster summarising the Residential Life and Housing Teams here in SUTD. This poster highlights how both teams work closely together to make your hostel stay experience a pleasant and memorable one. Happy reading!

Also, if you have feedback on how we may improve our newsletters, or would like to contribute an anecdote/comic strip/memorable quote etc. with us, we would love to hear from you!

Sincerely in Service,
Kellie Sim (Telegram: @kellief0rnia <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Ft.me%2Fkellief0rnia&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7Cba5a886acef140eb41c308d976a1beea%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637671259486039133%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=is7wpxHuyBIWOzY4JoYAQbtCs0yD8JO6BTPUeDKU0fk%3D&reserved=0> )
HG Newsletter IC 
HOUSE GUARDIANS
SUTD Residences

Subject: Announcement: FabLab New Normal For Fall Term 2021
Body:
Students,

 

Please refer to the latest information on FabLab New Normal. 

 

Kindly note that FabLab Access & Booking Rights will be given to all “Trained Users” (refer to attachment for more info).

 

For newly joined students (Freshmore Cohort 2021), further instructions will be sent to you shortly on “FabLab Safety Induction Training” related matters (this includes Maker Essential Trainings – Practical).

 

Looking forward to seeing you at FabLab!

 

 

Thank you and have a nice day.

 

(On behalf of FabLab Administration)

Subject: Important:Your account has been updated accordingly. Please log in to the housing portal to view your invoice.
Body:
Chua Yi Qi, ,

With reference to our recent billing email, please note that your house guardian subsidy amount for housing fees has been applied to your account.  

To view the charges and make payment (if there is any balance due), please login to the housing portal (https://hms.sutd.edu.sg/ <https://hms.sutd.edu.sg/> ).

1) If you have an approved GIRO arrangement, you do not need to make any payment  for your balance amount (if any) until further notice.  The GIRO deduction date is 1 October 2021. Please ensure that you have sufficient funds in your account 3 working days before the deduction date.  Should the GIRO deduction be unsuccessful, you may incur a $20 late payment fee.

2) For those not on GIRO or whose GIRO has not yet been approved, the due date for payment is 20 September 2021 (Monday). Please note that a late fee of S$20.00 may be imposed for missed payment deadline(s).  Payment modes:

i) via the housing portal using eNETS / VISA / MasterCard credit or debit cards (Login to https://hms.sutd.edu.sg/ <https://hms.sutd.edu.sg/> )
ii) via SingPost SAM (kiosk / web / mobile).  Key in the invoice number (5XXXXXX) shown in the invoice as the reference number when making payment. Please email us a copy of the receipt. There is a SAM kiosk at level 1 of block 61.

If you have difficulties in making payment, do approach us. 

Logging into the Housing Portal
 
Your housing login details will be your student ID and password (same to login for WIFI). After logging in, please click on accounts tab. On the accounts menu at the top of page, click (2)  to make payment online. 
 
Students are to contact IT Service Desk (help-it@sutd.edu.sg <mailhelp-it@sutd.edu.sg>  or +65 6499 4500) for assistance if unable to login, if there is a need to reset password (check if password has expired or not) or to unlock the account (check if account has been locked). Students may also use this link: http://itservicedesk.sutd.edu.sg/index.php/2016/05/10/student-self-help-portal-user-guide <https://apc01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fitservicedesk.sutd.edu.sg%2Findex.php%2F2016%2F05%2F10%2Fstudent-self-help-portal-user-guide&data=04%7C01%7C_chua%40mymail.sutd.edu.sg%7C7b7f3092085c487cce2a08d977ea6b2d%7C3476b776e9904f72b95062489831623d%7C0%7C0%7C637672671025477551%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PgR9kRS9thH1wiB7k4k7IjYlUKr0HQ46QWtn16fQg6Y%3D&reserved=0>  to reset the password.
 
 
For queries, please email the Office of Housing at ecchousing@sutd.edu.sg <mailecchousing@sutd.edu.sg> . 


Thank you and best regards,


Office of Housing

 Best Class Spirit Award AY2020

 

 Students,

 

We are very encouraged to see that many of you have put in great efforts in promoting team spirit among yourselves, thereby making your Freshmore year with the university a very memorable one. Based on the submissions of your Best Class Spirit reports and the evaluations by the panel of judges, we are pleased to announce that Cohort 20F05 is the winner of the Best Class Spirit Award for AY2020. Cohort 20F05 has won a cash prize of SGD 300 and a trophy.  Congratulations!

 

With best regards,

 

Lim Bee Foong

on behalf of Prof Pey Kin Leong, Associate Provost, Undergraduate Studies & SUTD Academy
